Reviews.Title: Great Value, Has Quirks Like Nearly All Current TV's
Reviews.Author: Gabriel N. Getchell "gfunk"
Reviews.Content: The TV is simply a very good, simple TV. As stated by many others, this TV does not have the sort of Internet Connected bells and whistles you find on more expensive sets. This doesn't bother me - I have 3 devices hooked up to this TV that are already able to do Netflix, Hulu, etc... and far better than I've seen built into a TV. I recently purchased the 50" model and have enjoyed it thoroughly (and I'm very, very particular about image quality).The TV is a bit thick compared to many other LED lit LCDs - not an issue for me since it will not be wall mounted. The thickness is the result of LED rear-lighting versus LED edge-lighting. While the latter allows thinner panels, the technology inherently lowers the image quality. More expensive sets overcome this issue and provide great pictures, but at the lower-end of the price spectrum, image quality is may be better served by rear-lighting. The set also has none of the "flashlight" effect (bright spots along the screen borders) that is common in even high-end edge-lit sets.IMHO the black levels produced by a TV are the single most important aspect of overall image quality. This TV does a pretty-darn-good job, but don't expect it to be nearly as good as a decent plasma television. If you keep a few small lights on in the room while you watch a movie the blacks will appear quite nice and dark. In a pitch-black room however, you'll be looking at dark gray instead. The trade off is this TV gets brighter than most plasmas on the market, making it's picture clearer in a brightly lit room. Some edge-lit sets can dim portions of the screen to improve the black level, but this also comes with image trade-offs such as "blooming" (seeing the edge of the brightly lit portion of the screen spilling into the dark areas). Unlike some very high end sets with "full-array" rear-lighting, this set cannot turn off individual LEDs to dim portions of the screen.This is all really just a long-winded way to say that this TV seems like a good deal, and seems to have image quality that is comparable in several ways to more expensive sets. After weighing the trade-offs of many (MANY) TVs, this seems to have been the right choice for me. It would have gotten 5 stars, but Samsung has decided to put only 2 HDMI inputs on this set (1-2 less than others at the price point). Its a mild annoyance having to use an HDMI switch for several of my components, but far from a deal-breaker and possibly not an issue for the majority of people.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Value
Reviews.Author: adamjive
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great value in the Samsung line.  At the time I purchased this, it was $1000(!) cheaper than the step up model with 3D and smart TV (I have the 65").  3D isn't important to me at all, and I have an Xbox so all of the streaming and stuff wasn't important either.  Forget what Cnet says about this TV, I find the picture to be solid and the black levels to be completely acceptable for an LED.I'll get the CONS out of the way first...It's a little thicker since it is a full array LED, but that's ok in my set up and I prefer the full array as it tends to give more consistent lighting than edge lit.The biggest knock is the lack of input/output options.  I am trying to simplify, so it's not insurmountable in my case, but if this will be the center piece of a complex set up you'll probably need a receiver to get all of the processing you will want.  One note, the optical out down converts to stereo from 5.1/ 7.1 etc. so you'll want to consider that.That's it on the CONS.  The picture is great, the processing of signals seems to be solid, and there are no artifacts when watching fast moving action.One major thing I did find with the picture, however, is the "Auto Motion Plus" setting.  This makes high def movies look terrible for some reason.  Like it was shot with a handheld camera.  I have found no benefit for this  setting and suggest turning it off immediately!I tweaked settings for a few days and feel like I have honed it in:1. PICTUREMode: MovieBacklight: 18Contrast: 80Brightness: 45Sharpness: 20Color: 55Tint: G50/R501A. ADVANCED SETTINGSColor Space: AutoGamma: +1Dynamic Contrast: OffBlack Tone: DarkFlesh Tone: +1Motion Lighting: Off1B. WHITE BALANCER-Offset: 26G-Offset: 24B-Offset: 25R-Gain: 24G-Gain: 25B-Gain: 201C. PICTURE OPTIONSColor Tone: Warm 2Size: Screen FitDigital Noise Filter: OffHDMI Black Level: LowFilm Mode: OffLED Motion Plus: Off1D. AUTO MOTION PLUSAuto Motion Plus: OFFGreat TV, get it!

Reviews.Title: For those who don't need internet $tuff but want an AWESOME TV
Reviews.Author: A. Lyons
Reviews.Content: If you want a smart TV or a 3D TV, this is not one. That being said, I wanted a TV not another computer-like device, and this fits the bill perfectly. My Bluray player has Wifi and all that jazz if the mood ever strikes me, so why pay hundreds (literally) so my TV can have it. I don't think I'd ever use it, I have a laptop and a smartphone for those types of things. I think there are lots of us with that viewpoint about a TV.If you want a brilliant HD picture, a nice big-but-not-crazy-huge 50" screen, then this TV is perfect. The thin bezel (frame) makes it look like it's all screen while you're watching it, it's nice! The sound, while some people say it's awful, is actually quite nice considering NO thin LED TVs have booming sound. Compared to TVs of yesteryear this TVs sound is actually nice & crisp with a little bass (not much) and fairly spacious. I find it VERY adequate for day to day watching. i also have the Vizio VHT215 soundbar for when I want to crank it during a movie. But if you've never been a theater sound person then don't believe people who say this TVs sound royally sucks, it doesn't. It's fine, maybe a notch above similar thin TVs on the market.It has 2 HDMI ports so you can hook up your satellite or cable box, and your Bluray. If this angers you because you also have a Wii or an Xbox, then you'll have to make the sacrifice of either a) a switch, or b) moving a cable, which takes all of 5 seconds. Or if you have a soundbar that has HDMI inputs (like the Vizio VHT215) you can pipe your devices into it (as a switch) and then feed the signal(s) to your TV that way.If this TV had everything under the sun it wouldn't cost only $1100 and be on sale often for around $800-900. It would cost $2400....which is what some upper-end Samsungs do cost. So therefore, don't believe the criticism that this TV is "mediocre" based on the fact that it lacks things that make it pricier. It is 120Hz (midrange to good); 1080p (as good any other); 20watt sound (good, on par with competitors); 50" (well, it's big but not huge- plenty for sitting 10-15' away); Nice looking (as most black TVs are); Matte screen (keeps extra reflections to a minimum); has a backlit remote control [the buttons light up] (a touch that most competitor don't offer- nice for night time viewing); has zillions of color, brightness, LED level, smooth motion, movie, dynamic, blah blah blah adjustments (if you're a tweaker you can tweak to your heart's content); it has a joystick-style control on the bottom right-of-center edge instead of buttons (for power on/off, settings, menu, etc- unique to most TVs).Anyway, you get the idea. It has all those things new TVs have, plus Samsung's reputable picture quality. Oh, and it states it costs an average of $11 to run. For a year. Wow. I think my old Sony boob tube cost that a month! And I'll brag a little, this TV only cost me $447. Haha, I scored four $100 gift cards to Best Buy from work and it was on sale for $799. Cha ching for me.Uber-happy with this TV because I knew what I was buying before I bought it, and it has what I want and not extra bloatware I don't need. well worth the $800 sale price, and I honestly think it's worth the $1100 retail tag.Cheers!

Reviews.Title: I HATED THIS TV! Then adjusted Calbration Settings. Now I love it.
Reviews.Author: FRod
Reviews.Content: Greetings!I HATED THIS TV!Yes you read that right. HATED IT. This TV out of the box produces one of the ugliest, most jagged and off color pictures you might have ever set your eyes on, especially if you're upgrading from a Sharp Aquos like I did.Seriously considered returning the TV even after getting it for a great price ($997).Searched on the web for a bit then found this:[...]This guy used a calibration tool for the following settings. This made the TV go from Mr. Hyde to Dr. Jekyll. The TV is absolutely gorgeous! One star was removed because 1080i content doesnt look great. Prime time sports look amazing, sub 1080P not s much.Here we go. Every owner of this TV should definitely give these settings a shot. BEAUTIFUL!1. PICTUREMode: StandardBacklight: 20Contrast: 90Brightness: 50Sharpness: 30Color: 55Tint: G50/R501A. ADVANCED SETTINGSColor Space: AutoGamma: 0Dynamic Contrast: LowBlack Tone: DarkFlesh Tone: +4Motion Lighting: Off1B. WHITE BALANCER-Offset: 20G-Offset: 30B-Offset: 20R-Gain: 25G-Gain: 25B-Gain: 301C. PICTURE OPTIONSColor Tone: StandardSize: Screen FitDigital Noise Filter: OffHDMI Black Level: LowFilm Mode: OffLED Motion Plus: Off1D. AUTO MOTION PLUSAuto Motion Plus: Clear2. SOUNDMode: StandardSRS TruSurround HD: OffAuto Volume: Off2A. EQUALIZER100Hz: Two notches down from highest "+" setting.300Hz: All the way to "+" setting.1KHz: Two notches down from highest "+" setting.3KHz: All the way up to "+" setting.10KHz: All the way to "+" setting.3. GAME MODE: Off-----------Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: awfully nice tv
Reviews.Author: slikwoody
Reviews.Content: our sony tv went out due to the optical block going bad. searched all over for a replacement and tried two other tv's. tried the sharp 70 and lg 65. both were nice tv's but didn't have the pizazz the sony had. saw this model at costco and amazon. amazon had a very good price with no taxes and free shipping, plus a 30 return policy. i figured i could not go wrong. tv arrived in a matter of a few days via amazons carrier ceva. they delivered it and set it up to my satisfaction. the tv has the best picture i have ever seen on a tv. totally outstanding. on the second night i noticed two large clouds on the screen in dark scenes. i was totally bummed out and called amazon to come pick it up. i decided to look on the internet to see if other people had this problem. sure enough they had. there were quite a few different remedy's. quite a few people said to use a soft micro cloth and rub the spot gently. so, i bought a cloth and tried it. to my amazement and with very little rubbing, it went away. i called amazon and cancelled the return. by the way, my wife wanted to keep it regardless of the clouding as the picture was second to none. i will have to say, if you're looking for a very good tv without all the bells and whistles, this is it. i am 70 years old and have never NEVER seen a tv like this. it doesn't get any sweeter than this. you too will blown away. trust me. one more thing, amazon was one of the best experiences i have had dealing with venders on the internet. the people and service were great. i'll be back.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but some features will make you say WTF?
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: I have the 240hz version of the TV.  The picture is great but Samsung's engineers and their customer support are idiots.  First of all, the picture is great but here are the caveats:1. The media play feature is nice. It let's you hook up a hard drive via USB to watch files.  The problem is that if you are using the feature, you can't adjust the picture with the remote.  As soon as you try the playback stops.  The problem is that when you play files from the HD the picture is very dark and there is no way to adjust.2. LED Automotion is 'ON' as default.  This will make the picture look like it's in 3D.  I hate it. Turned it off after wondering why all the images looked like I was watching a soap opera.3. For audio out, there are only two options: headphone jack and a optical audio out. The problem is when you hook up speakers to it, you CAN'T adjust the volume with the remote control!  You can adjust the internal TV speakers, but if your sound bar or speakers do not have a remote for volume, you are screwed.  I emailed Samsung Customer support and their canned answers are a joke.  They can't even discern what is the problem.  Therefore, for sound, you really need to hook up a receiver to the TV or make sure that your speakers have a remote included.

Reviews.Title: Top 3 in this price range compared. Samsung wins.
Reviews.Author: Chad D. Hummel
Reviews.Content: The best review in my opinion is a comparison to other products. Those are most helpful to me.  I'll compare the Vizio 65”E  the Sharp Aquos 60” 755u and the Samsung UN65EH6000.  I had narrowed it down to these 3 tv's based on price (all $1300 at time of purchase) and excellent reviews(over 4.5 star).Remote:  The Samsung and Sharp remote are quite nice. The sharp for some reason has their sensor dead center on the TV to where I would have to hold the remote way up high so the center speaker didnt interfere/block the the signal. Solution would have been to raise the tv up with a piece of wood or something or reposition the center speaker out of center. Wall mounting isnt an option since in my home there is no option except for in front of a window.  The Samsung remote is great,the tv's IR sensor is on the side like most tv's Its almost the same remote as the 2007 tv.  Both remotes are very good. Vizio on the other hand provided about the cheapest remote I could imagine. It has to be pointed in the exact right spot to work. Even with brand new batteries. I've seen many reviews stating the same thing. They have to know with a bigger tv, maybe individuals arent sitting as close to the tv set so a stronger IR signal is needed.  I don't recall ever having an issue like this with something brand new.  It just felt cheap and like it could easily break.Base/Stand:  All 3 are about the same. The Sharp maybe a little better probably because it was supporting a 60” instead of a 65”. The Sharp did seem to have a little bit of a lean to it, like it wasnt balanced. Like one side of the tv was heavier than the other. But nothing major. There were complaints on reviews for both the Samsung and Vizio base. Both have a little wobble to them,but  both would need quite a jar to knock them over.Picture Quality: Obviously each have their own opinion but  I'd rank Samsung #1 Sharp a close #2 and Vizio a distant 3rd.  Cnet reviews do not match my personal experience. I tried many posted user settings and my own calibrations using the Disney WOW disk and trial and error.  The vizio at times would look ok but always seemed like all scenes took place in a light fog in the middle of the screen. Some setting changes helped but never completely went away.  Its a thicker tv so I assumed its backlit and not edge lit like the Sharp.  Still scenes looked wonderful but motion did not. There was a lot of graininess in the background most of the time.  We returned this tv to amazon for those reason  along with the awful remote, terrible glare issues on the screen, and some glare issues of the bezel.  The bezel is  a shiny black plastic that reflects light like you wouldnt believe, its also wavy like its  warped so the light reflections off this bezel are extremely annoying. I'll be honest I'm surprised to see no mention of this on the Amazon reviews. That being said, If this was my first flat screen tv I wouldn't  realize the PQ is slightly sub par.  The Sharp was very nice. Excellent looking quality on everything about it including PQ. It was a little too sharp looking sometimes , even with sharpness turned down. It created artifacts in the image. Really not bad though and better than the opposite affect . Color was best out of the 3. The smart part of this TV was so far ahead of the Vizio in layout and speed. This tv also has 3D  which I wasnt interested in nor the smartTV. I have my own devices that do what the SmartTv does. Roku and a bluray player perform those functions faster and better.  I seen an HD roku at walmart for $28 far cheaper than increased price to incorporate it in a tv. First 3d experience with the Sharp. Was surprised at its quality compared to movie theater 3-D. Still not that interesting to me and I dont like wearing glasses to watch TV. The piece between your eyes is annoying everything is a tad darker and lacks focus. I didnt buy it for the 3-d.  There was more of a glare issue with this tv and we also felt cheated in that we had to downgrade in size. The 70” was out of price range. After  watching a 65” for a week a 60” seemed so small and that we werent getting what we wanted and what we spent our hard earned money for. . If the Vizio would have worked out we wouldnt even have tried this TV.  So we bit the bullet and got the Samsung which I should have done in the first place. It was more only because we bought it at best buy and had shipping and state sales tax. It doesn't have the smarttv feature or 3-d . It only has the best picture quality of the three. For us it came down to that.  The out of box settings werent as good as on the Sharp.  There were many setting posted for this tv in reviews I tried them all but all resulted  in a worse picture for me. Even the WOW disk resulted in a worse picture. It took tweaking with my own eyes to get the picture to  look amazing. . I actually wish there were less picture settings, no reason for that much change if its properly calibrated at the factory.  The Samsung by far has the least glare problem. Watching a football game now looks like  your watching it through a glass window. Like my old Samsung. The Sharp looked like you were watching a cartoon or video game of a football game, thats exaggerated to make the point. I won't post my setting unless asked because as I said it appears that each set requires different setting or its user opinion.Side notes:  Amazon was great on the return of the Vizio. Full refund although the tv is still sitting in my living room, its been over a month. The shipping companies are busy during the holiday season. No fault of Amazon.Also I feel I have to mention this. I am disappointed with Vizio support. A phone call and an email got me about 10 emails replys from them. Each stating they can't help me. It would be best over the phone. One stating they could not provide any assistance with the remote since its made by a 3rd party. What??That being said I did not get a reply from Sharp support, even though I was told I would within 4 days.  I have never had to call Samsung support as Ive never had an issue.Out of the box the Samsung needed the backlight and brightness turned down that was 99% of it right there.  Some motion scenes did look odd. I tweaked the blur (5) and judder (10) settings and its much improved.  Hope some of these comments help.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value and Impressive Performance
Reviews.Author: Nameless
Reviews.Content: Impressive performance, excellent looks, and excellent value earns this TV five stars. I feel like this TV is worth more than I payed for it. If you want a big TV that performs well without spending a lot, this is a TV to consider. I've purchased one for the living room and another for my bedroom. That's how much I love this TV. I use it for HD Comcast, video games, and for blu ray. Amazon instant video looks great on this as well. Other big TV owners who've come to my home are always impressed by this TV. Name brand performance at value band pricing. It's a win win. Buy this over a value brand like Vizio or Westinghouse.TV settings I use (always consider your video source and lighting conditions). Images look sharp and clear without the "soap opera effect." :Mode StandardBacklight 20Contrast 100Brightness 45Sharpness 35Color 48Tint g50/r50Color Space AutoWhite BalanceR Offset 26G Offset 24B Offset 25R Gain 24G Gain 25B Gain 20Gamma +1Dynamic Contrast OffBlack tone OffFlesh tone OffMotion lighting OffColor tone CoolSize Screen FitDigital Noise Filter AutoHDMI Black Level NormalAuto Motion Plus CustomBlur Reduction 10Judder Reduction 0LED Motion Plus OffSound: Default settings. I use the default settings because it makes dialogue easy hear and understand.

Reviews.Title: Still Great
Reviews.Author: Mandy Payne "Is it just me?"
Reviews.Content: **update**I just wanted to say we are coming upon a year and still love this unit.  I am purchasing another for a Christmas present for a college bound child.  The TV is priced right and so intuitive and easy to use that we love it.  The price has decreased significantly too.Previous review:We've had this TV for several months.  We were happy with the original purchase and are still just as happy.  The picture is amazing and the size is ideal for our 18x16 room.  I use Roku on it along with Xbox and a blu ray player.  All of them work seamlessly.  This television gets almost constant use and we have no complaints.  Setting this up was very simple and using it and its features is just as simple.  It doesn't have every bell and whistle, but the TV itself is just incredible.The TV is priced better here than at Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: Good Performance, Great Value
Reviews.Author: Louis
Reviews.Content: Summary:Pros:Really great pictureVery brightNo motion blurringGreat for gaming (low latency)Even backlightingViewing angles - brightness remains constantCons:Viewing angles - blacks wash outGlossy/reflectiveColor quantization error (see below for explanation)Full Review:Samsung sources the panels used in its TVs from 4 different manufacturers, listed here in approximate order of picture quality: Samsung, Sharp, AU Optronics and Chi Mei Optoelectronic.The UN65EH6000 has so far only been seen with panels manufactured by AU Optronics, using version numbers MH01/02 or YH01/02. Mine had the YH02 specifically.At face value this looks bad - you are getting a Samsung TV from the 3rd worse panel manufacturer that Samsung uses. In practice, all 65" Samsung panels are all either made by AU Optronics or Samsung themselves (and only then in the 65F8000 range at three times the cost of this set. UPDATE (1/30/14): Since writing this review the 65" Samsung panel has also been seen in the UN65F7000 range). So perhaps a better perspective is that this is the second best 65" TV you can buy from Samsung.What does this mean in real life?The AU Optronics panel has inferior contrast to the native Samsung panels, in particular the blacks turn into blues when you view from a sharp angle. Off-axis viewing is still better than many edge-lit TVs (I'm looking at you Sharp and Vizio) largely due to the fact that this TV is direct-lit (this is not a "sexy" TV by any means). Sat in-front of the set, blacks look superb, and watching typical television from an angle you probably won't even notice the blueish blacks, but if you are planning on buying this set to watch movies from a sharp angle (why would you do this?) then I'd have to recommend looking elsewhere - either a plasma or perhaps a direct-lit IPS based LG (for example the 60LN5600), of course these displays have their own problems.On that note - this TV is glossy. Glossy enough that I can clearly make out my individual lights if I happen to be sat at an angle where they are reflected. If you have something like a bright window that you could see if you placed a mirror where this will go then trust me - you really do not want this TV.  That being said, this TV is capable of getting extremely bright (I personally have the backlight set to 12/20 and many people set it lower) without obliterating black levels so it will do just great in a bright environment, just make sure nothing will be directly reflected from where you are sat.A major issue with this panel is something called "quantization error". The hardware on the TV has to translate the digital color information into a real physical color by determining which "sub-pixels" are turned on or off (each color (r,g,b) for each pixel is controlled by a number of sub-pixels which are turned on or off to vary the intensity of that particular color). Color "quantization error" is loosely analogous to aliasing if you are familiar with that problem. With this particular panel either a bad algorithm or a hardware limitation results in defined bands when attempting to render a smooth color gradient. Many LCD displays suffer from this problem but it is particularly evident in this case. Upon discovery of this problem my gut instinct was to return the TV immediately, but in practice the problem rarely manifests itself when watching TV/Blurays or playing games. I do see it from time to time (sunsets are affected) and some people can't accept it, but for me the beautiful picture makes up for the odd artifact.There are some great advantages to this panel. There is no evidence of motion blurring and latency is very low (I've seen 39ms reported) - this is a great TV to game on. I was blown away by how good blurays looked on this set and Wall-e, which I thought would severely be effected by quantization artifacts, looked incredibly good. A nice bonus of having a direct-lit TV is that you shouldn't suffer from uneven backlighting which is often seen using edge-lit displays and my particular TV had no clouding.Settings:I am an HTPC user and have not used the built in tuner.First you must re-label the HDMI input as PC or PC DVI - this changes the underlying behaviour of the panel. These settings only work if the TV is driven at 1080p60.Mode: StandardBacklight: 12Contrast: 90Brightness: 40Sharpness: 50 (this needs to be very low when the input is not labelled as PC)White Balance: UntouchedGamma: -2Color Tone: Warm1HDMI Black Level: Normal (experiment with this as it depends on the source).

Reviews.Title: Great..  BUTTTTTT
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: Tv came in fine. Delivery service was good. Soon as i opened it i loved it. Very good looking tv. BUTTTTTTT.. as the sun went down (my living room has lots of natural sunlight coming in thru the day) i noticed that during dark scenes or when the screen goes black as scenes change, there is a patch of black thats not as black as the rest of the screen. So in other words, theres is a patch of a lighter color black on the screen when a dark scene comes in. I figure its a defective unit because obviously this should not be happening. Its very noticeable and very annoying. I spoke to amazon and they will be swapping it out for a new unit. I will update in a couple weeks when it arrives.  If it wasnt for this issue.. It would be 5 stars no problem. But since im going thru the hassle of this BS. I cannot rate a 5. Like i said i will update after i examine the new unit coming in.EDIT: New replacement came in. The shipping company took the one i was returning.  TV looks good. Easy process no hassle. I will inspect it thoroughly in the following days.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: NewEnglander "NE"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon during the black friday sale this year and got a pretty good deal. For less than a grand, a 65" LED, that too back lit and not edge lit. can be considered a good deal in my eyes. To give you a little background, I am a picky person when it comes to my audio and video. My existing setup had a Panasonic plasma, albeit a few years old, Energy take classic speakers, Denon receiver, and Monoprice cables. I like quality products, but at a reasonable price. You can sure buy Bang and Olufsen speakers, Macintosh labs receivers, Panasonic Kuro or ZT60 TV and other high end equipment for better quality and pay significantly higher price for the same but that's just not me. I had been researching the available 60"-65" TVs for quite a few weeks and read through detailed AVSForums, CNET and HDTVGuru reviews and many other forums to get an idea on what's out there that would appeal to a more value conscious buyer who does not want to sacrifice on the picture quality. I was initially very skeptical because CNET rated this TV pretty low due to subpar black levels but when i compared this one to other comparable TV sets in this size range, the difference was minimal.I zeroed down to this TV, Sharp 60LE650, and Samsung 6400 series. I decided not to consider Samsung 6300/6350 as the picture quality on that set is, at best, as good as 6000 series. The thin factor did not matter much to me and frankly backlit TVs are supposed to be a bit thicker vs edge lit. I did not care for "Smart" as in my humble opinion, even the smartest of the available TVs cannot keep up with the Rokus and Apple TVs of the world. I know for a fact that TV manufacturers, as a habit, do not think about providing backward compatible upgrades that will work for TVs that are more than a year old. So I was not willing to pay $300 $-400 premium for smart TVs when just using an Apple TV or a Roku can provide me with all desired content and then some more. I also did not care about number of HDMI connections as I already have a receiver with 5 Inputs. And frankly, even if you do not have a receiver, you can always add an HDMI switch for less than $20 and you will be all set. And then again for sound, you can buy a sound bar or setup a home theatre if you have a receiver. Make sure you buy the model ending in 6000 if you plan to add a sound bar directly to the TV. The models ending in 6001 and 6003 do not have an Audio out so your only option would be to add sound bar to your cable box or other device which limits the options.Back to the TV review, as I played with the settings, out of the box settings looked ugly. But just a little playing with the settings to adjust contrast, turn off Auto motion plus, Set Mode as Movie, and other adjustments to my taste and picture looks good, reasonably good. Again, I had seen the best of the TVs in the stores including Panasonic ST60, VT60, ZT60 and  Samsung 8000 series and while the blacks on those TVs are better, I could not justify spending over 2K on them. The picture quality difference wasn't that dramatic. The sound on the TV sucks but then you can add a soundbar for just about $100. I did not face any issues, so far, with any light bleeding, banding, or other image issues, reported by other reviewers. I did a pixel test on YouTube to check any dead pixels and there were none.  Colors were sharp, looked realistic with some playing around, and picture was bright enough even while trying to get better blacks on the TV. There are multiple forums where you can find all sorts of settings for tweaking the picture quality. I would advise trying some of them and see what you like. For those who care, my panel was YH02, supposedly manufactured by AU Optronics but I won't sweat it. I bought an extended three year warranty so I think I will be covered.I seriously think CNET needs to review this set again as they reviewed this set in 2012. I did read in the forums that initial set of UN65EH6000 TVs in 2012 has panel problems which may have swayed CNET's results but more recent panels and updates seem to make this model a good buy. So if you are one of those who want a BIG TV, without the BIG price, and are prepared to use different components for smart content, this one is a keeper. If money is not a question, go ahead and buy a ZT60 if it is still available. I will update the review as Time passes and I have had a chance to look at this TV side by side vs my 50" Panasonic plasma which I still love. But for less than half the price vs a Panasonic top end 65" model, it became a no brainer decision.

Reviews.Title: Terrific image, once settings are adjusted
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Like all recent Samsung LCD TVs, this is capable of producing a really fantastically lovely image once its settings are adjusted, but the settings it comes with from the factory are just terrible.  The first thing to do is to turn off, or use the Custom setting to turn way down, the motion-smoothing effects, which otherwise ruin the depth and look of every camera pan or track.  Next, adjust the backlight all the way up, and change color, contrast, and brightness to taste.  I found I needed to reduce the contrast and brightness significantly below the maximum, while using the black-level controls as well, to get a less artificially "poppy" image than the unit's default settings.  Sharpening also needed to be turned way down to reduce unpleasant artifacts and stay true to the source material.  There is still a bit of unevenness to the backlighting, even with the LED backlight, which surprises me -- the edges of the screen are sometimes noticeably brighter than the middle -- but it's quite easy to live with, for the most part, and produces a great picture once adjusted.  The speakers are also surprisingly okay for dialogue -- much better than those in slimmer units -- but really, anything this nice should be hooked up to a full speaker system for better enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: Viktorija
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!!! The picture is very clear and nice. Also, the whole complaint about the default setting making everything look to soap opera like is true but it only looks that way because it makes every person or channel look as if the action is happening right in front of you in real life. Even old movies look good on this TV. So, yes you can change the defaults to look more tv like but then what's the point of buying an HDTV when you want the picture to look like an old style tv. The whole point of HD is to have everything look as real as possible and this TV delivers that greatly. If you have no interest in 3D tv then this is the tv for you even if you want a 3D tv all you would have to buy is a 3DFury adapter and it can make this or any other TV a 3D TV in seconds for an extra couple of hundred bucks. So, if you do that, you'd have a $6k Samsung TV for this TV's price. Basically, the best TV choice you could make is this TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice bi screen but watch out for problems
Reviews.Author: Randall G. Rich
Reviews.Content: I really wanted the 65" and after reading the reviews the Samsung seemed a great fit, no 3D, no Wireless, just your basic HD TV with a measly 2 HDMI ports. After using for a few days I noticed what looked like a flash light shadow on the left side of the screen which was centered on the side and not touching corners. I figured it would go away and watching, you can only see it during dark scenes. I read all the tips n how to tune it to avoid this but its still there and its time to get it fixed.  Given the price, it is NOT worth it and because of the size I can't just pack it back up.  Had it been installed like I was lead to believe it would have been back on the truck. I suggest you refrain from buying anything this large online or you too will have a problem getting it fixed. At least the local Best Buy, Sears or whomever can come back and deliver a new one.

Reviews.Title: Purchased two - both had dead pixels
Reviews.Author: Antidentite
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be the perfect TV for me, since I do not need 3d, apps, or an extremely thin TV. I just needed a large TV monitor with good picture quality, which this TV certainly has.The only problem is that I've gone through two of these so far and both have had dead pixels on the screen. I thought the first one was a fluke, so I returned it and got another of the exact same model. Unfortunately, that one also had a dead pixel in a different location.Both were manufactured within the last six months, had firmware version # 1018 (which ironically is a higher version than what's on the Samsung support site which is 1012. A chat with a support rep told me that updating to 1012 could damage the TV, although AVSForum members indicate differently), and both were hardware version HSO1 (avsforum indicates you should try for the ST01 or ST02 versions since those are Samsung panels, but those options weren't available at the local retailer I purchased these from).I'm sure I just got really unlucky since I doubt most of these come with dead pixels, but returning multiple TV's of this size is extremely inconvenient and disappointing, which is why I gave it a single star.

Reviews.Title: When I Walked Into The Room And Glanced To My Right, I Thought That I Was Looking At Some People In An Adjoining Room!
Reviews.Author: Scott E. High
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "WOW!".  My wife and I went to see our daughter's new apartment.  The entrance had a nice feeling since it opened up into the family room.  After I took a few steps in and noticed motion over my right shoulder, I turned to the right and initially thought that I was looking at people in another room.  It turned out to be a control room shot of "Avatar" on Blue Ray.  Even after looking at it for a moment or two it still seemed so realistic that my eye was drawn to the back of the shot.  In other words I really felt like I was in the picture.My wife made the same unsolicited comment and I knew that we were looking at something special.  We both sat down and watched more of the movie instead of looking through the house with my daughter.  At first she seemed a bit miffed but got over it when I began gushing about her TV choice.  She got the set without the "smart TV" settings because she could add them later with a separate unit and then wouldn't have to return the whole thing if something went wrong.I have a first generation Samsung LED and didn't realize how much positive change has taken place over the past several years. Of course having true 1080p and a 240 refresh rate makes a big difference. Now I feel like I'm as out of date as an old pair of shoes.  Time to upgrade!!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture
Reviews.Author: Marlyn L Carter
Reviews.Content: I started looking at 65 in TV's after my old LCD went out after 8 years. I finally narrowed down the Samsung due to the picture quality and budget. I went to Best Buy and they did not have one in stock at my nearest store, but could get one sent from another store for a fee. So I decided to look at amazon and low and behold they had it and offered free shipping and no sales tax. I ordered it and was given a 10 day delivery window. I was notified that my new tv would be delivered in 5 days and they were right. Ahead of a schedule and very professional delivery personnel. They took it out of the box and helped set it up. I am sure I can fine tune it but it looks great with factory settings. Very happy and will use amazon again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, AWESOME Customer Service!!
Reviews.Author: Renay
Reviews.Content: We ordered this TV after asking a lot questions at local stores and reading many, many reviews.  We really wanted JUST a TV, no Smart Technology.  When we received the TV, it has been shipped in just the regular box.  The back of the box had been damaged and the bottom portion of the TV had a big dent.  I filled out the exchange information online and within a few hours we received an email from Amazon that they had shipped another TV overnight and sent a call tag for the pick up of the damaged one.The new TV arrived the next day inside a shipping box with a lot of packaging around it.  Much better.  The new one was perfect, damaged TV was picked up and we are very happy!!One note:  We did not like the "soap opera" effect everything had, so we followed the settings given in the review by Jason and now it's perfect!!  (Thank you Jason)  If you want just a great quality TV with no internet options, this one is good choice.Thank you Amazon for the excellent, fast customer service.  We will stay Prime members now just for this reason.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Choice
Reviews.Author: Micheal D....
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV since the end of September 2012.  I studied these items for over 2 months before settling on this unit as it best met my requirements and price point (about $850 at that time). I would point out that it replaced an older 27" CRT SD TV, so when I say it was a home run, you understand what it was compared to.  I looked it up on the (CNet) reviews and used their suggested settings.  IT LOOKS GREAT! I live in a rural area and use an Over-the-Air antenna - reception/tuning is FINE. I have hooked up an old DVD player to the composite (r/w/y) input and have no problems watching DVD movies.  I have also hooked a Magnavox 515 DVR in via the HDMI input and that works well, also.  The 2nd HDMI input was used for my HP laptop and that too works perfectly.  Additionally, I purchased a 3-to-1 HDMI switch in case I want to expand the number of HDMI ports.  The sound is just fine for about 75% of the shows we watch requiring a setting of only 17-22.  The other 25% are produced/broadcast so that they need more volume and the TV handles that pretty well, too.The only real negative is that the base stand feels pretty shakey, so I anchored the TV to the wall behind it via a bolt inserted into one of the holes for the wall mounting bracket and a tether extinding to a wall anchor.All in all, I think it's a KEEPER!

Reviews.Title: The perfect TV for what I want! No Smart TV, no 3D, just a beautiful picture!
Reviews.Author: Billy
Reviews.Content: This review is for a UN65EH6000F purchased through Costco for roughly the same price here on Amazon. I went with Costco because I was able to take advantage of the cash back and the extra warranty coverage.Here's the short version:ProsFantastic picture quality! Blu ray movies are GORGEOUS and as a gamer I see no noticeable artifacting or tearing from the fast motion of games.Thin, lightweight, easy to calibrate (I used the Disney WOW blu ray and it was great for me. I don't want/need any crazy advanced calibration)Pros to me that might be cons to others:Not 3DNot "smart"Not Edge lit ( I'm no a/v expert but I've heard "full array" LEDs have less risk of negatives like light bleed that some edge lit TVs can suffer)2 HDMI inputs, that's all I needed! I have a blu ray player and an xbox, and eventually will just have an xbox one (or a Ps4) and the blu ray player will go awayCons:None (in my book, see pro's to me that might be cons to others in above list)Here's the longer story if you want more detail:I had a 50 inch Sony LCD rear projection that was a great TV for a long time but I've been wanting to upgrade to a 1080p TV for some time and I have no interest in a 3D TV or a smart TV. So it looked like a great opportunity to pick this TV for a great price and get exactly what I wanted.I mainly watch streaming shows, blu ray movies and play games on an xbox 360. The most important factors to me are great picture quality with minimal to zero blurring/artifacting from motion of games or sports. I did not want "smart" or "3d" or any of that.The TV was easy to set up. It's about 70 lbs so I just set it on it's side for a bit, screwed the stand on, and then put it up on the stand and it was ready to rock.Picture Quality:Right out of the box the picture was pretty darn good. I fired up Game of Thrones on HBO GO and it seemed some brighter areas of the picture were a little washed out. Sure enough when I ran through the Disney WOW calibration DVD I ended up bringing the brightness down a few clicks and that was really the only adjustment I needed to make. Once I started watching the blu ray samples on the Disney WOW disc I was blown away at the picture quality! Absolutely gorgeous with no noticeable artifacts whatsoever. I watched The Hobbit on blu ray and was amazed at how gorgeous it was.Sports/Gaming:As a sports and gaming fan a major concern for me is blurring or artifacts from fast motion. I watched plenty of hockey highlights as well as played some xbox on it and so far everything looks fantastic. No complaints at allViewing angle and distance:I read some reviews that the viewing angles aren't good on this TV but they look great to me. I stood off to either side of the TV (about 45 degrees off center) and didn't notice any picture degradation at all. My ouch is set up about 10 feet away from the TV and that's a good distance for viewing the 65" screen. If you want to get more "immersed" you can move it up to about 5-6 feet away and there's no noticeable loss of picture quality and it's great for really getting into a movie or game.Some people complain about:2 HDMI inputs but this is all I need. I dont have cable so I just need a blu ray player and xbox hookup. Eventually when I upgrade to a gaming console that has blu ray built in I'll only need one hookupSound - I only tried the speakers for a little bit because I have a sound bar but I thought the speakers sounded really good. If anything they're probably missing some bottom end which is typical for built in speakers. Either way, I feel TVs like this deserve external sound anyway to really get that Home Theater experience. Personally, I'd rather have them start not including speakers at all in large TVs like this and save some money and put it toward better home theater speakersThat's about it. I'm really loving this TV and if you're looking for a fantastic picture without extra bells and whistles then this TV is a fantastic choice!

Reviews.Title: If you are okay with simple, it's perfect!
Reviews.Author: Brian Grzymkowski "Brian Grzymkowski"
Reviews.Content: I have a Playstation 3 that serves as our blu-ray, netflix, and prime player.  We subscribe to Verizon Fios cable, and we have 2 Macbook Pros and 2 iPhones.  Put simply, we felt there was no need in our lives for a smart television.  We have plenty of things in our home already that can capably browse the web.  We weren't interested in 3D either.  It's a fun novelty for the occasional movie, but for us, it wasn't something we felt the need to have in our daily life.  We wanted our TV to just be a TV.  That being said, we hoped for one that offered a clear, sharp picture at a reasonable price.We've had this TV for several months now and couldn't be happier.  Could it have more HDMI input jacks?  Sure.  Could the TV be thinner/lighter?  Sure.  But the refresh rate is great, the picture is excellent, and the sound is actually better than I had anticipated.  Lots of visual and audio settings to work through, so it takes a little time to find your preferences.If you are using this TV primarily to watch TV, movies, and play video games, you won't be disappointed.  At this price point, it really can't be beat as far as I'm concerned.  If you want bells and whistles, the thinnest profile out there, or lots of connectivity, this probably isn't the model for you.  For those looking to keep it simple without sacrificing quality, this is a great option!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture After Period of Adjustment
Reviews.Author: Sy
Reviews.Content: The picture looks great although it's our first hi-def flat-screen  TV, having just recently upgraded from a 27-inch heavyweight, so I can't compare it to other high-def flatscreens. Some broadcasts are so sharp they practically look like they are in 3-D. In the beginning I was a little upset that the movies didn't have that crisp film look and resembled live video (even 1930s black-and-white films) until online advice suggested I deactivate the blur motion mode and now movies look like movies and live or videotaped broadcasts look appropriately "live."  You definitely have to go through the various settings and make adjustments to your taste to get the picture you want. But I understand that's true of all the new TVs being offered.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the size and cost
Reviews.Author: Nadine
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about many different televisions before deciding on this Samsung.After reading one person's great detailed review on this tv we decided to go with it.  We weren't looking for a smart tv but we wanted to find the largest screen that would fit in the space we had available, a great picture with easy set up and not be too expensive.We've had several Samsung televisions in the past so we knew the quality was good if we stuck with the Samsung brand.All in all we are satisfied so far but we've only had it for a couple of months so the true test will be time.

Reviews.Title: lot of screen for little money
Reviews.Author: Thorn
Reviews.Content: no tricks.. it is what it says it is..  65" LED  1080p with 240 CMR.  Beautiful picture!  Its replacing a 52" Samsung thathung on the wall for years ( replaced three capacitors for $12 and still looking good and now resides in a smaller room).  The 65"Samsung fills the space with such clarity whether its with a PS4 game or a movie, it allows you to relax knowing you've made a good choice!  3D and Smart TV were options which added about $300...and since I use a Blu ray DVD or the PS4 to watch Vudu, Netflix, Amazon etc....and a DVR to keep track of favorites...don't really need the Smart portion ...or am I about to plunge into the 3D Market.Great choice for a big screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV - Horrible shipping story!
Reviews.Author: shomann
Reviews.Content: Let me first say this is the first really negative shipping story that I have with Amazon and I have been buying from them for 10 years.Also, let me get this out of the way - the TV is an excellent set for the price. It has good light distribution, good color saturation, and good black levels for it's size and tech (65" and back-lit LED). I can't comment on the speakers as it was immediately wired into our home theater system, but it's features are adequate , considering its a non-Smart TV (which I wanted).So I am happy with the TV.It took a month for Amazon to get it to us.I ordered this as a Cyber Monday deal on November 27, 2013. as most of you shopping this category knows, Amazon offers an "Enhanced" Shipping service due to the size of the item. Basically, they must rely on 3rd party freight shipping companies outside the normal FedEx/UPS/USPS services. These companies are supposed to bring the item to your home at a time window you choose when you order. I choose my delivery date as Dec 5, 2013 from 2-6PM. After that time had passed, I was on the phone to Amazon. They told me my TV was in my town, but held up due to weather. Fair enough, I could wait over the weekend and was told to expect a call the following Monday.Monday came and went with no TV. I followed up with Amazon on Tuesday and was told to wait through the end of the day on Thursday, a full week after the initial scheduled delivery. Starting to get annoyed I consented. Thursday, Dec 12, 2013 also came and went with no TV. That evening, I called Amazon again and was told they could not find my TV (shocker) and that they could only offer a refund on the item. So, basically, I missed my cyber monday deal because at that point, the price had gone back up to about $300 more (from multiple retailers). Upset, but determined to keep cool I accepted a refund.The next day, I was called by Amazon and told that I had to speak to a supervisor to process my refund because of the item amount. At that time, I grilled him on why I couldn't get an exchange instead. He was also mystified that I didn't have that option and investigated further. In the end, he was able to get an new TV sent as an exchange. Cool, I was told it would be there the following Wed, December 18, 2013, but I couldn't get a specific schedule. I would be contacted by the carrier for a delivery time.Wednesday came and went. I called Amazon that evening and was told the second item was now lost as well. Really? I took the refund and vowed to never older anything larger than a book from Amazon ever again. My wife, after stewing about it for several hours demanded we get our TV. This was late in the evening, but during that call we were told our TV was still en-route. Not really believing anything at this point we were told the refund would be processed and the TV was still being shipped to our house. Fine, we will believe it when we see it.6 Days later I helped 2 delivery guys bring this TV into our house. This was Dec 23, 2013. Hurray! Leaving the mess of the refund re-processing until after the holidays, we started enjoying our unicorn of a screen. A week later, having heard nothing from Amazon, and yet seeing the refund applied to our accounts, I reached out to them again. After a long 20 minute conversation stating that I owed Amazon money (instead of asking for another refund), I was routed to someone in retail sales that was able to reprocess the original payment.We still wonder to this day what would have happened if we never contacted them, the last time. Free TV? Possibly - though that wouldn't have been good karma.Think long and hard about a large item purchase from Amazon. They have much less ability to track items, or find out where they are exactly when they use third-party freight companies.

Reviews.Title: Strange screen image
Reviews.Author: James E. Yourishin
Reviews.Content: The center of the screen, when black or dark had an opaque image that was 24" x 12'".. Set had to be on then the image was  there.  Currently awaiting replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sam Nelson
Reviews.Content: After a some adjustments to the settings the picture is great and the sound is good. Looks incredible hanging on my living room wall.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN50EH6000 50-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Hurrle
Reviews.Content: Thought we would have to buy a sound bar  but sound is good.  Much better than on other flat screen TVs.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Monster
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This giant tv is wonderful. It has amazing picture quality, passable built in speakers (though I doubt many people in this price bracket will use them) and a nice clean facade.The stand could feel a little sturdier in my opinion, but if you're going the wall mount route like I expect most people are it won't make much difference.I love this tv. Also amazons shipping policy here is insane. I didn't pay a dime for any of it, including tax, which wound up undercutting places like best buy and Costco 450 dollars.

Reviews.Title: Great tv at a good price!
Reviews.Author: JESSE KIM
Reviews.Content: If you don't need/want options other than a beautiful picture, this model is the way to go. If I wanted the Smart tv functions, I would hook up a PC to it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV while it lasted.
Reviews.Author: Matt Turco
Reviews.Content: I got this TV last summer (2013) and it worked great. Color was good and overall physical quality of the TV is nice. Plenty of picture options for tweaking and even without any adjustments to the settings themselves, it picture quality was good. Understand that you're getting a TV with limited ports, so if you need a main room TV with multiple devices attached, look elsewhere.This TV fit me perfectly and I liked it until about a year after I got it the TV when problems started to occur. It started one day when the TV wouldn't turn on. It wouldn't make the clicking noise and the standby light would just flash, then turn off. I left it for a day upset that my warranty had just ran out only a week before. When I tried it the next day, turned on no problem. I shrugged it off for a week and now its starting to power cycle randomly. It happens every few hours of watching, sometimes more frequently sometimes less. The TV will shut off on its own, turn back on ~5-8 seconds later. I've tried switching outlets and power strips and no dice. Been living with it for now, but its frustrating when the power cycles do happen. I'm not even sure where to begin with fixing it as I have no way to reproduce the problem on-command.Maybe I am just unlucky but I am seriously disappointed that this happened. I got it for a good price last year and since it was good while it lasted, I will leave 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Misleading Comparison Chart
Reviews.Author: Aravindan Mahendiran
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful TV. Love the picture quality. The sound though a tad bad out of the box can be improved substantially with a bit of tweaking.The TV has just 2 HDMI ports though which is a bit of a annoyance. I din't check the seller provided specifications(which correctly states 2) but the comparison chart provided by amazon before which states 3.Somebody ought to correct that before other people get disappointed

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Monica Linerode
Reviews.Content: We just bought this 50" led T.V. at our local store on sale for 850. The sound is great and we won't be needing an extra speaker system for it. We really love the picture quality, everything is clear. While at Samsung's website, I saw that this model is no longer available and we're glad that we bought it when we did last week.

Reviews.Title: If you don't need a smart TV or 3D this is a super deal.
Reviews.Author: Dion A Moe
Reviews.Content: I replaced an older 52 inch Samsung TV with this unit. I cannot speak to the sound quality as we have a surround unit doing that chore. The picture is as good or better than the previous unit. I do recommend spending a few minutes and find someones post with a set of basic settings to remove the "soap opera effect" (that the unit has by default). After we dialed in the picture we have enjoyed the unit. We only bought the new one because the home we purchased has a huge family room and we sit 15+ ft away from its place on the wall. (The 52 went off to a bedroom) . My older Samsung is still doing fine after over 5 years. Another reason I like Samsung never had a problem with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Just a fantastic picture.  Blue ray movies are just gorgeous.  All of this for a great price. This is the perfect TV for my first LCD purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great tv.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Eady
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv.4yr. warranty plan.Thank you amazon.Even the gf loves it.I don't rate 5 stars, but this 65" tv does it for my family.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality
Reviews.Author: Charlie Ironmonger
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture and the 120 Hz makes this TV feel like the the action is happening IN the TV. Only issue is the number of HDMI ports (2), but for the price and picture quality, this is a steal.

Reviews.Title: that's awesome
Reviews.Author: BYEONGIN KIM
Reviews.Content: i think this one is good for our family.We already used Samsung TV before but this is first time buy on Amazon.delivery that's good and fast quilty also good.if you need cheap and good display TV you should take this!

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Dean Harris
Reviews.Content: I wanted a large size tv for a decent price and I got one. Not many ports on the tv though. Only 2 had I ports and components.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as my other Samsung LED televisions.
Reviews.Author: Hal A. Pena
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Samsung  LED and it does not measure up to the other three. The color is not as vibrant as the others and after making many adjustments, I am still not satisfied with the picture quality.The television did not work out of the box and Samsung had a service technician at my home in 72 hours. The "motherboard" was replaced and the lack of sound problem was corrected.I was pleased with Amazon's and Samsung's service but, frankly I expected more from the television.

Reviews.Title: Hoping it will break--65" TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Samsung and, although I love my 4-yr-old LCD, this TV is awful.  I can only guess the majority of these positive reviews are for the smaller tvs, which probably look better than the 65" TV that I bought from Amazon (great price and service, by the way--my only regret is that I can't return the thing without paying a small fortune in shipping!)  The colors are off and no amount of calibrating and adjusting can make them right.  Believe me, I've spent hours looking up different suggestions and getting to know the TV's color controls far better than I ever wanted to.  Blacks are just gray, reds are muted, and movement is often blurry--like the TV can't keep up with the change of information.  Using the standard or dynamic visual modes results in brighter colors, but severe loss of information--even blurrier motion and distinct pixellation that looks nothing like a real picture.  The sound is just okay, though I prefer the speakers on my older TV.  I don't mind not having Smart features, and using an external box to attach multiple devices is fine, but I Really Mind that this TV doesn't look right--and I strongly suggest anyone considering the 65" look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture, don't need no bells&whistles;
Reviews.Author: Winter is Coming
Reviews.Content: So I really was about to buy a 60" Sharp Aquos for myself, but I kept reading all these reviews about motion blur and just was getting a lot of mixed reviews. I was leaning towards an Aquos because I have a 46" at home from about 5 or 6 years ago that is only 60Hz but ZERO motion blur, it doesn't do that weird feels-like-you're-on-the-set thing, and has great overall picture quality. So I was leaning towards another Aquos. I went to the B&M; store that has that big blue and yellow logo and that ripoff "product support team" LOL. I stared at their wall of TVs and immediately started to agree with all the people complaining about modern Aquoses.I didn't want to spend more than $1000 on a TV but for fun I ventured down the wall to the right where the prices were going up and there's a lot more Samsungs...I started ruling out TVs based on picture quality ALONE not even looking at prices. I knew they'd be better farther to the right because it was going to the high-end end. BUT I was really blown away by this TV compared to the LG's, Sony's, VIZIO's (maybe? I forget if Vizio's were present). Basically the LG's were OKAY as were the Sony's. They were very grainy. Now I know this isn't scientific, but all had the same NON-HD connection; all had the same picture playing; and theoretically the grainy-ness wasn't something the store could mess with to make the more expensive TV's look better. The Aquos were terrible with motion blur. This is all in reference to TV's in that 800-1200 price range I was browsing. I came across these 4 Samsung's on the wall and after eliminating the 46 because it was too small and the 55 because it was too much, I found this price amazing for the picture quality!One thing to note: since they have these in B&M; stores, and now that the Blue&Yellow; store prices matches AMAZON, you should for sure go check it out in person! No joke, they are price matching Amazon, but that doesn't matter since they're the same $799 price now. Seriously, this TV is AMAZING. I bought it for $809 at first and $799 is like a candle on my birthday cupcake.One thing to note: when I'm watching a movie, I have to turn the TV volume all the way up just to hear all the dialogue. BUT the TV rattles any time there's bass playing in the music or like an explosion goes off. SO...you will definitely need some speakers to go with this TV but some of the Polk audio Monitor60 series II are on sale for $99 a pop, GO GET THEM! And let's not argue about which speakers to get, just go get some.Summary:-TV destroyed competitors in terms of what I was looking for (#1: no motion blur. #2: not grainy picture. (I notice if colors are WAY off, but unless you're watching 2 TV's to compare colors, I'm not that picky about them))-Bang for Buck is insane-Speakers need some backup-TV looks good off too-Remote is a remote-menu has been easy to navigate but that's not why I buy a TV-I turned off their "smooth picture setting which made it look weird"Recommend to a friend? Heck I already did! My family might buy one for our home soon!

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware!!
Reviews.Author: M. Kim
Reviews.Content: TV has decent picture quality, but very disappointed to find out I got the lowest quality panel for TV. Check version number on sticker on box or back of TV. If it says CH01, like mine does, you lost the lottery. That means that you DO NOT have a genuine Samsung panel, but a low quality panel installed into a Samsung shell.I have lost respect for the Samsung company. I expect something like this from Sanyo, Westingtonhouse, or any other low level brand. I will be selling this TV and now on the market for a new Sony HDTV.DO NOT buy Samsung!!I would have given this product a 1 star, but the picture isn't bad and I got it for $780.Buyer beware! Do your research before buying this TV. Thought I had done enough (1 year worth), but I was wrong.Thanks for nothing Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Bob Pickering
Reviews.Content: Just the right size and features for us.  We wanted the fast refresh rate, but we didn’t want 3D or Wi-Fi.  (We use our Blu-ray player for internet access.)  The picture is great.

Reviews.Title: perfect, only 1 complaint, doesn't have native mac mini resolution at (1920x1080)
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: The tv will output at 1080px (1920x1080) my mac mini with hdmi. So, it may affect other computer input.However, as a workaround, Roku outputs at 1080p, and I can use Plex through roku and get 1080p on on this tv.no 3d, no smart tv, just the way I like it. It's a cheap big tv that displays a picture.

Reviews.Title: Just the TV Thanks!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Smith
Reviews.Content: I have my TV mounted to the wall.  It goes through a receiver and a home entertainment speaker system.  This means that I just need the TV as a monitor.  I don't need 3D, I get Netflix through my Xbox, I don't even need speakers.  What you pay for in the new TV's is the Smart TV - that is - Internet, Apps (much like smart phone apps), Facebook, NetFlix and so on and these features bring the cost of an equivalent TV to twice the price of this one. If you are like me and just need the display then this is an awesome buy.  And the display quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Does It Again
Reviews.Author: J. Parker
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Samsung HDTV and once again it has an amazing picture! I didn't want/need a smart TV and I can't stand 3D. I think you'd be hard-pressed to find a better non-smart TV. I bought it for $897 which I think is a bargain for a 50" 120Hz HDTV. Amazon 2-day shipping and their customer service is second to none. I still have a 40" Samsung LCD that I bought in 2007 and it's still going strong. I will continue to buy Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: No complaints about the product.
Reviews.Author: gregory s buchler
Reviews.Content: The delivery company Amazon contracted apparently can't read a clock, but I have no problems with the TV.  Yes, it uses backlighing LEDs so it is thicker than side-lit LED TVs, but:  a) backlighing can theoretically provide a better picture, and b) it's still so thin that it does not get in the way of anything.  My center speaker mounted just below is far thicker.  I also read that this TV has inferior black, meaning it doesn't show a true black.  The black sure looks black to me...It does only have 2 HDMI inputs.  I don't care, because my A/V receiver has 6, and that's where I do my switching.  I also don't care that it's not a "smart" TV.  I got a Roku box.  I prefer to keep those functions in separate products, just like I stayed away from the combo TV/VCR units long ago.  I can update each function if and when neccessary as technology evolves over time.

Reviews.Title: Grandpa is happy!
Reviews.Author: Ashley Z.
Reviews.Content: I helped my grandparents purchase this and upgrade from their old, giant, heavy, full box TV.  They are so happy with the picture and sound quality!!!

Reviews.Title: What can I say - it's a Samsung.
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Shreves
Reviews.Content: Several years ago, I bought a computer monitor and it was a Samsung. It is still in service on my desk. The next time they were on sale, I bought another one for my music studio. It is also still in service. The remotes are very well-designed.When it came time to replace the old-time 42-inch Sanyo TV, I knew that I would get another Samsung. The 50-inch model that I gotworks great with a blue ray disk player (Samsung) and an Apple TV hooked up to it.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommed!
Reviews.Author: KD
Reviews.Content: I couldn't possibly love this TV more!  This TV has such clear picture and looks great in any living room/movie room!  It looks like we are watching HD TV or blu ray discs all the time, and when you actually are watching HD or blu ray, it pops even more!  It's like you are actually there and what you are watching is in the room with you!  I would highly recommed this product to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV without all the "Smart TV" stuff - They're getting harder and harder to find! Looks AMAZING with Xbox One!
Reviews.Author: Byron D. Miller
Reviews.Content: It's getting harder and harder to find a nice, beautiful, sharp and crisp LED LCD TV these days that doesn't have a "Smart TV" functionality.  Being plugged into an Xbox One and a PlexApp Media Server, i don't want or need any of that stuff.  I just wanted a TV with HDMI and a beautiful picture and this set delivers.* Picture - Very vibrant colors, lots of options, lots of settings. You can enable/disable the 240hz motion display, set to Cinema mode and customize the colors/options very well.  Picture is nice and fast - BluRay looks absolutely amazing and the Xbox One really shines on this console at 32bit color depth, 1080p/60.* Size - its not a "slim" set by "slim" standards of today, but its much more slim and lighter than my old 37" set it replaced.  It fit on my existing mount and installed without any hassle. The 50" (49.5) panel is absolutely perfect if you ask me. Great viewing size, great with games, great with movies, great with my PC. I wouldn't want anything smaller and I'm not sure its worth paying more to go larger - most people go so large the issues of LCD / LED and even 1080p resolution come into fact and they don't know the larger the TV, the larger you may need to sit back to not see such artifacts..* Screen - There is a bit of reflection on the panel with daylight.. i haven't seen a panel that doesn't have this issue and really, after looking at my old tv, its only noticeable because this thing is just HUGE - more to reflect.* Remote - basic.. i won't use it much. I have mine connected to the Xbox One and it recognized the TV and allows me to use the voice and SmartGlass controls to control the TV.* Audio - I'm not using the Audio, I go from Xbox One to Receiver then TV - My Receiver does the audio decoding/playback. Sorry.. i'm just not investing in a 50" TV to be stuck with 2 speaker audio and not sure why anyone would :)* HDMI Ports - It has two. That's it. I can't stand it when people know this and yet rate the tv negatively.  Go buy a receiver with multiple HDMI inputs and listen/watch/play on your TV in surround sound as it was meant to be :)* USB Port - Has a USB slot that will allow it to update firmware as well as play media.. I'll probably never use it, but its there.My TV was packed inside a separate shipping unit very nicely, I only had problem with the holiday shipping being delayed in Mesquite Texas during the UPS Holiday backup they had.  I wouldn't hesitate to order a set from Amazon in the future, just don't do it around the Holidays :)Gaming on this TV so far has been awesome. I'm not seeing feeling/seeing any latency from the Xbox One and the 1080p and even 720p games look absolutely beautiful, color rich and sharp sharp sharp!  Playing Forza 5 looks amazing, Max is crystal clear, Peggle two really pops on this display and Assassins Creed is just awesome.  I was able to set the Xbox One to 1080p, 32bit color depth and RGB colors. I also ran the Xbox One calibration tool to make sure the colors were sharp and detail was set as i wanted and after doing that, i was able to leave the HDMI port in Cinema mode and have everything look amazing.Have i said amazing enough yet? :)  No dead pixels, great packaging, easy install and I was gaming within 5 minutes of opening the box!

Reviews.Title: Excellent !!!!
Reviews.Author: Rodman "SixShooter"
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Picture is excellent. Only complaint is I wish it had more HDMI inputs (only has 2). Also only has one composite input. But the picture and sound quality more than make up for it. Samsungs have the best pictures out there.

Reviews.Title: Super!
Reviews.Author: Mia-Cat
Reviews.Content: Its a great TV, The picture is great and it doesnt lag like other tvs, its great for watching star wars! not 1% of it looks bad!

Reviews.Title: Make Sure Your Living Room is Big Enough
Reviews.Author: Steve Casi
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Walmart and had to return it. Unless you at least have a 30 feet by 30 feet living room, I would not recommend this TV. It strained my eyes as my living room was smaller. There is nothing wrong with the TV and picture quality and sound. A good speaker system would go perfect with this.

Reviews.Title: Big but light
Reviews.Author: Mike Tango
Reviews.Content: This thing is huge and functions really well, as is my experience with all Samsung products.  But more remarkable is that it is surprisingly light. I mounted this on the recommended wall bracket and it has been wonderful.  Unless you are absolutely compelled to have the largest this, or that, you will really enjoy this.

Reviews.Title: very nice tv, for the price. not fancy but great for the non techie....
Reviews.Author: R. J. WAGNER "Rich"
Reviews.Content: very nice tv, for the price. not fancy but great for the non techie....very good picture,good sound. just right for my older folks..

Reviews.Title: Samsung 50" HDTV
Reviews.Author: Tumbleweed
Reviews.Content: For the price and intended use, the Samsung 50" HDTV satisfies my needs.  I was looking for a basic HDTV for our bedroom.  This HDTV has a good picture and sufficient ports to hook up DVD player and stereo.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Stuntman Mike
Reviews.Content: Used mainly as a monitor for my cable box / PS3.  No frills, just a solid LED / LCD screen.I had (have) a 47" model with 1,000,000 inputs and apps, but never used any of it besides the HDMI inputs.  It was broken by movers and I bought this 50" to replace it.  Picture quality is the same down to the menus, can't complain.As fast as the smart TVs are growing / adding features...  It's good to have if you have no other access to the internet or a media player, but I'd rather just use PS3 / XBOX / ROKU / etc.  Much easier to update a device like that than the TV itself, or pay to upgrade your TV every year.5/5 - I got exactly what I ordered and it has been on 14 hours a day with no problems for the past 8 or 9 months.-Mike

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Leo G Doyon III
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. I love the picture quality and performance, not like the super thin televisions, bit absolutely live the TV

Reviews.Title: Soap Opera Effect
Reviews.Author: Jonathan D. Scanlon "jdscan"
Reviews.Content: The sound and picture all work well with in the space we've placed it however,can anybody tell me the steps to remove the soap opera effect?

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Sdlee
Reviews.Content: I bought this one beside the 60" LG Plasma at the same time.  Put this one in the livingroom and other one in the family room.  I see that LED produces little sharper image and see the difference in sizes comparing to 60" TV.  With the price I paid, it was a very good buy.  I first considered the smart TV, but decided to buy the BluRay player with Wifi instead to have the web browsing capability on my TV.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Timothy Menihane
Reviews.Content: Perfect size. Excellent picture quality. Couldn't be more satisfied. I would recommend this TV to anyone. Buy it while they're still available.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: This TV is well worth the money. It has a great picture and is easy to use. I'd definitely recommend this TV to anyone looking for a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love this television! I shopped around and found that the prices are nearly the same everywhere. United Parcel Service delivered it in perfect condition. I did tune the picture as some of the other reviewers suggested and that made a great improvement. Sharp and clear!

Reviews.Title: Best Bet For An Excellent Basic TV
Reviews.Author: Daniel E. Rosenberg
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is a best bet for a basic, not smart or 3D TV.  The picture quality continues to amaze me and because it's not one of the super thin LCD's it actually has decent sound because it has room for speakers.  I paid $849 and at that price it's a steal. Buy it you won't be sorry.  If you want a smart TV buy yourself a ROKU Box, it will give you all the internet TV you want and costs only $50 and up. It has a much better user interface than any smart TV I've seen.

Reviews.Title: This is a nice TV
Reviews.Author: Timos
Reviews.Content: I've owned this TV for a month now, and I am happy with it.  When I consider the criticisms of flat panel TVs in general or this model specifically, the two main items that come to mind are poor sound and too few peripheral connection points.  I have been happy with the sound, but I respect that it would be better if it had another HDMI port.

Reviews.Title: Want something for the extra room great, for game'rs there is better
Reviews.Author: DanScan11 "DanScan11"
Reviews.Content: I love the Samsung brand. But this TV has shown it was lacking in the most important thing a TV should bring to the table its display. If you don't have it on the "entertainment" preset the colors are pretty dull and washed out. I did download and install the newest firmware which positively helped sharpen the picture up immensely. It got rid of a lot of the ghosting if you use it as a PC monitor. response time has been good though I could not find the actual time my best guess is 5ms since my Toshiba is 8ms and I can tell a difference in lag. Blacks aren't great they tend to have a brightness of their own. I've shifted every conceivable setting to get a more pure black no go unless you want even more dull red's and yellows. Green has been the worst though they tend to show up brighter than the rest of the color's when you mess with the settings to turn them down the rest of the colors seem to go to pot. All that being said if this is your first HD set or something you want for your kids or bedroom to watch movies and TV then this is a ery serviceable set, I do NOT recommend this for a monitor or a gamer's primary display.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV last year on Amazon -- took advantage of some sort of black Friday or lightning sale and got a pretty great price.  Delivery was spot-on.  I am very happy with this purchase.  Only problem is that my friends always want to hang out at my house because my tv's so much better than theirs!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful LED
Reviews.Author: zoobu
Reviews.Content: I hung it up on the wall, and it looks great.  I did no buy the superslim and I was worried it may be too thick, but it is fine.  I also do not miss the smart TV feature because I have a PS3 which I runs netflix, youtube, amazon prime, etc.Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: EB
