Reviews.Content: This is a great TV picture.  Lack of HDMI ports is only an issue if you use the TV as some kind of distribution center.  If you do that, it's probably better to get a receiver too.Daytime mode is a tad bright, but adjustable.120Hz seems better for sports than 60Hz.

Reviews.Title: The last of the great LCD tvs.
Reviews.Author: J. M. Batic
Reviews.Content: Every lcd tv now is side lite and its terrible. The uniformity of the image is awful. This tv is back light and has none of those issues. The trade off is no smart options and limited inputs. I wish tvs would go back to the back lite design. I has to return a more expensive model because of all the problems from a side lite tv. This Tv the Eh is amazing for the money and will hold me over for the next 2 - 3 years as I wait for 4K tvs that thankfully are back lite.

Reviews.Title: Xbox 360 Gamer Review - No input lag!
Reviews.Author: P. Certain
Reviews.Content: I had been trying to research a new LED TV to replace a 37" 60Htz LCD TV and I couldn't find any specific reviews that mention input lag/response time for playing video games. I play first person shooters and require a TV that responds to my controller's movement instantly. This TV is GREAT as far as response time is concerned. I didn't notice the slightest bit of lag EVEN WHEN GAMING MODE WAS OFF! There was no noticeable difference between the normal and gaming modes. You can take the same advantage of the "Auto Motion Plus" as you do on HDTV and Blu-Ray inputs (if you like the "soap opera" effect) without suffering any lag effects. I am extremely happy with this TV as it is exactly what I was looking for for gaming, movies, and TV viewing.So, don't bother with Gaming mode, it limits the other fine-tuning you can do with the picture.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Went Cheap on this Model
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Sparagis "Nick S"
Reviews.Content: This review is for the UN50EH6000 model. This is my second Samsung TV.  I was very happy with the first Samsung LCD I purchased about six years ago.  It was time for an upgrade, so I'm thinking LED with a faster refresh rate.  This should be the image I'm used to, but better, right???Let me preface by saying that I'm keeping the TV b/c I got too good a deal on it ($750).  I don't think I'll find a better TV for the price.  I guess I was expecting better quality b/c it's Samsung.Here goes.....the default image settings all look terrible.  The colors are way off.  I found a link that fixed these settings on CNET:  [...]  I used these exact settings except added "Auto Motion Plus" > Smooth.  Watching basketball was giving me slow motion at times.This fixed the image for the most part, but there still seems to be some pixelation and the blacks are not good at all on this TV.Also, this model is probably intended to be mounted on a wall b/c the base does not swivel.  That's a feature I miss.  Also, the components are anemic on this unit.  I need an audio out for some wireless headphones that I use.  I have to run them through the cable box, which is not convenient b/c I also need them connected to my blu-ray player.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected
Reviews.Author: Andrew Beasley
Reviews.Content: It is a very good TV. Sure it does not have all the bells and whistles and has a limited number of HDMI slots, but it does do the job well. Only complaint I have is that the built in speakers could be better, but I plan on getting real speakers and a receiver to compliment this TV. Considering three years ago, a TV like this cost 2400, I would say I am happy with with what I got for the price.

Reviews.Title: A litlle spendy but worth the extra $
Reviews.Author: Peter Ward
Reviews.Content: I first avoided this unit because of the price. Brought home a Vizio and then a Toshiba that both went back to Costco. I could not get either of them dialed in. In frustration I started looking at plasmas but was quickly discouraged by the salesperson from that direction.At first getting the Samsung hooked up I thought I was doomed by having too high an expectation. I found several people's suggestions on calibration, tried them all, and finally settled on one that was closest to what I thought met my taste. The next couple of days I did some minor treaking and experimenting to fine tune everything. Once I was satisfied I went through the programming and logged all my settings in the event of power failure or whatever.One thing that really made a difference was originally I had it just hooked up with a coax cable from my Dish receiver through my home cable system. I moved the recever right next to the tv and used a HDMI cable directly from the receiver. VIOLA! That's what made the huge difference in the clarity of the picture. To bury the receiver in the cabinet I ordered a new remote from Dish so the receiver would work on UHF instead of infra red. Dish's 722 receiver only allows HDMI hookup on "channel 1" which is normally IR. Dish recommends RG6 cable which I don't have in my older home. Anyway, if you find an issue with your picture you may want to consider how you have it connected.I have no doubt that you would be happy with this tv. The amount of settings for picture and sound are plenty for all particular tastes. There are cheaper units out there. I ended up paying $850 (more than I really wanted to)but am totally satisfied with the product. I missed out on Costco's double warantee but have purchased the Square Trade 3 year extended warantee from Costco for $60. Hope this helps someone. Good hunting!

Reviews.Title: A Great Value
Reviews.Author: John D. Atwell
Reviews.Content: This Television was one of the greatest deals ever on a very large screen backlit LED TV. For under $1500, Amazon shipped this TV to my house, set it up, and removed the packaging material.The picture is outstanding after adjustments.  Blu-Ray is incredibile.  The College Bowl games were a joy to watch, and there was no motion blur.The TV speakers are decent for regular TV viewing, but you will want to add either a surround sound system or a soundbar to better enjoy your movie watching experience.I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a large screed LED that doesn't want or need such features as 3D or Web interaction.

Reviews.Title: Perfect set for the money--all the needed features without the expensive fluff!
Reviews.Author: John in Phoenix "John"
Reviews.Content: We've had this TV a couple of months and it does exactly what it's supposed to do, and does it exceptionally well.  The black are black and perfect, the LED backlighting is even and consistent, it was easy to calibrate (I used a combination of two other reviewers' calibration settings to make it perfect for me), the picture is outstanding--deep, vibrant, and perfect.  Even the sound is really good for a thin bezel set with what must be tiny speakers--the stereo separation is even sometimes startling.  We often don't even bother to turn on the surround sound system, but just use the TV sound instead.  It beats the heck out of the 7+ year old Samsung 40" it replaces--there have been some great improvements and advances.  We chose this after looking at a number of others.  The only close competitors were a couple of LGs and one Sony--but as well as not being quite as good, they just weren't Samsungs.  NOTE:  This is the perfect TV in today's market ONLY if you already have your assorted Rokus and laptops and all the other toys we already have to allow us to enjoy streaming video.  If you don't have all that stuff, you might want to bump up another $300-$400 and get a so-called "smart" TV, because streaming video is the current wave.  I do wish it had at least one more HDMI input, but that's not critical.  I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN50EH6000 50-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Georges Jabbour
Reviews.Content: Great service - item arrived within 48 hours of ordering! Excellent tv, crisp picture at a price that can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Avoid the drama
Reviews.Author: David Starr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I noticed a very strange thing when we first sat down and streamed some of our favorite films in HD on our new Samsung UN50EH6000. The movies  looked like a daytime  drama shot in video rather than film; it was quite disturbing. After some research I discovered that there is something called the "soap opera effect" that makes this happen when this TV has the Auto Motion Plus setting left on. Turn it OFF. If you wish to learn more about the technical reason for this effect, search for an article entitled "The Soap Opera Effect: When your TV tries to be smarter than you". With that setting correction, the TV  image is now so beautiful, that sometimes I can watch a poorly acted or scripted film and just enjoy the pretty pictures.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG QUALITY
Reviews.Author: Sandra Lowe
Reviews.Content: Easy installation.  Easy set up.  Sterling performance.  Any negatives that I read about the sound quality were unfounded.  Good-to-great sound.  Menu-driven set up is simple.

Reviews.Title: Excellent set
Reviews.Author: Big Baller
Reviews.Content: This flat screen is fantastic. The colors are vivid and the dark black makes everything stand out. This set doesn't have all the smart features which I do not need. Only downside is only 2 hdmi connections which are hard to reach once mounted, but a hdmi switcher solves that.

Reviews.Title: Samsung For the Win!
Reviews.Author: Angel Trujillo
Reviews.Content: I made my purchase on Wednesday before Thanksgiving since I was scrolling the blackfriday adds online and had my eyes bulge out when I saw the price for this 65in LED Samsung TV. For $1400+ I couldn't pass up.The wife had been wanting an upgrade from our 40in Sony Bravia we purchased back in '06 so this was the perfect moment. Made the quick purchase at Best Buy, put it in the bed of the truck(almost fit the entire bed) and then back to the house.The moment I hit the On button, I automatically fell in love... and that was with a standard cable channel. I switch over to HD and was more in Awe. The next day after Thanksgiving dinner I invited my neighbors to check out the new addition to the house and decided to play a Blu-Ray version of 300. Everyone was in disbelief in the clarity of the film and made everyone jealous.We tried out the xbox360 and ps3 (COD:MW2 & Street Fighter 4) in Game Mode and it performed well, no complaints. We'll be hosting more gaming sessions at my house in the near future.I do hear people complain about there only being 2 HDMI ports but that's what switches are for and the one I use works great with no degredation of signal. I didnt need a smart TV due to having gaming consoles that already provide all the services of a Smart TV but better. Overall Best purchase I've made and BEST TV I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: Dish
Reviews.Content: TV has a wave in it. Nothing major and doesn't affect viewing programs but is noticeable withe the TV off. Not the best pic quality surprisingly.

Reviews.Title: My Samsung UN50EH6000
Reviews.Author: Herman Lauterbach
Reviews.Content: This HDTV serves us very well.  We did not need a smart TV with WIFI because it is connected to a smart Blue-Ray player.  The picture is great.  I would definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: great tv with some basic features
Reviews.Author: ALK "AK"
Reviews.Content: so the model number doesnt exactly match up but it's the same tv. I got mine from best buy for 999.99 and it seems to be working well.I've used it for the last few hours and it works great.This is a great tv for the money but this is definitely basic monitor with some inputs but NOT as fancy as some of the smart tv's you see on the market.This also is a bit thicker so if you are looking for something slim to mount on a wall this is not for you.But if you don't need any fancy features and need a really good display that's an amazing size it's great.It only has two HDMI inputs but i use AV system so all i need is just one anyway so it works great.

Reviews.Title: So far so great
Reviews.Author: robbiec
Reviews.Content: Just got the Tv set up so this is more or less first impressions review. Very nice looking set with fantastic picture quality without the 3d and smart tv stuff I did not want in the first place.

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: lvanhoey
Reviews.Content: I love Samsung and will never buy a different brand for my TVs. The picture quality is excellent and I have never had any issues!

Reviews.Title: Blown away!
Reviews.Author: Bob Seamon "shock1970"
Reviews.Content: I usually try to be fair in my reviews, pointing out the positive and the negative.  It might be a little hard to do so here.We bought this TV to replace a 6 year old, 42" Sharp Aquos.  There was nothing wrong with the old TV, but wanted a new one for our bedroom.  Do we buy a new set with apps and all the latest features?  Do we buy a small one for our bedroom and just keep the one we have?  Seemed that the prices for smaller TVs (~30") with high end features were just as expensive as their 42" counterparts.  A high-end TV with all the apps, bells, and whistles was just way out of my price range.  I decided on this TV, choosing to move the older TV up into our bedroom and to use the Samsung as our main TV in our family room.I ordered from Amazon and paid the extra $3.99 (via amazon prime) for next day delivery as it fit my schedule.  Fed-ex delivered on time without issue.The picture is phenomenal!  We'll get used to it someday, I guess.  My wife and I are amazed at how realistic everything looks.  Everything seems to pop out... its not three-d, but it just seems real.  I don't know if its the higher contrast ratio compared to our old set, or the fact that we jumped from LCD to LED/LCD, but we just sat there wondering what it is that makes everything look so awesome.  The colors are fantastic and it can be very bright in the light scenes, while still maintaining an almost pure black (you can still tell the black is back-lit if you really try, but far darker than our old TV).  Since I have an XBOX, I popped in Skyrim and explored a little in a dark dungeon... I was impressed with the level of detail I could see that I was not aware existed.The sound was really good too.  Compared to the old Sharp, I was able to hear sounds in programs that I wasn't hearing before.This wouldn't be a full review without some kind of criticism, and there are two things I have to say... 1) The TV didn't come with bolts for mounting to a mounting rack.  After I pulled the old 42" TV down (which weighed about 20 pounds more than the Samsung 50"), I was disappointed that I couldn't mount the Samsung right away.  I had to run out to Lowes and get M8 3/4" bolts and washers for about $3.  Then I was good to go.  2) The default color settings don't look all that great.  Doing a few searches for video settings on the EH6000 series, I was able to find some good recommendations for settings to use, then tweaked them to my liking.Weighing the pros and the cons, the cons aren't really a factor.  This television is rock solid, has a high refresh rate, and great picture and sound.  EPA estimates are that it will consume $11 per year of electricity!  I don't regret getting a TV without the apps and 3D.  I likely wouldn't use the 3D, and I have an Xbox to get things like netflix, amazon, and such.  I'll be happy with this purchase for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Sensational Samsung!
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for Samsung LED quality, but don't need all the bells and whistles like 3D and SMART TV, this is an excellent and a more affordable choice!  Outstanding picture and sleek lines.  Very happy with my purchase.  The only reason I did not give it five stars was because there are only two HDMI ports.  This may or may not be an issue for some, but three would seem pretty standard these days.

Reviews.Title: Picture Good
Reviews.Author: jeepguy12
Reviews.Content: Good picture. Has light edges around screen and the sound rattles the metal backing with even minimal sound level around 15.

Reviews.Title: Great basic TV
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Francis "Harley dude"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for just a "plain TV" this is the one for your you.  Not a lot of "bells and whistles" just a great picture at a good price.  Speakers sound good and picture quality is excellent.  The wife and I are very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: MAC
Reviews.Content: Had to return first one, had a flaw we couldn't figure out.Amazon was excellent in this, just said send it back and we will ship anotherout now.  They did and got the new one quickly.It worked great out of the box and now for 6 mths with no problemsThe picture is great.Don't know what else I could ask for, Great service from Amazon, Great product ata fair price.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Daniel Barnard
Reviews.Content: Love the tv. It said there were scratches when I bought it but there wasn't any. Extremely happy with the product

Reviews.Title: Very nice LED TV
Reviews.Author: Joe Strzyzewski
Reviews.Content: I wish the TV had more HDMI ports, but that can be overcome. Good picture.  Remote is very well organized.  Power cable is a bit short.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV in all areas
Reviews.Author: Joseph Gutowski
Reviews.Content: It was everything I wanted, I even got one for my son as a present. I am not much on rating, but if you want an excellent picture, this will do the trick.

Reviews.Title: Just Purchased, great looking TV
Reviews.Author: my_crib_too
Reviews.Content: Would have ordered from Amazon but found a better price.  Great initial impression.  Picture needs a bit of adjusting as others have mentioned but once adjusted, what a picture.  Nice sound too.  Simple TV but all I need.  Hung on the wall, hooked up, watching TV in twenty minutes.  If you don't need a smart TV, consider this one.

Reviews.Title: Great deal on a great tv.
Reviews.Author: Chris Glancy
Reviews.Content: Just bought Samsung as a gift for the inlaws. The picture is clear and crisp, the sound quality is excellent, and most importantly it is very easy to navigate the menus... I dont think my inlaws could have set that VCR clock back in the day.

Reviews.Title: Still a great display one year later!
Reviews.Author: Timothy Deschane "Jesus Saves!"
Reviews.Content: I have this hooked up to my home theater PC so I didn't need all that SmartTV junk, and was able to save big when I bought this last year. As always, Samsung produced a great display that isn't lacking in any area, brightness, clarity, depth of color, and contrast were ideal by my standards. I recommend this HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: M Hales
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the Samsung TV, we wanted one that wasn't too smart.  Works great and the picture is superb.

Reviews.Title: Great TV without the whistles and bells
Reviews.Author: tnbeachbumr
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a TV for the bedroom that gave me a good picture and refresh rate without having to buy one with all the extra, and not needed, technology (Smart TV/3D).  This one provided just that.  Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Must Buy!
Reviews.Author: K. L. Wheat
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT tv i would recommend this to anyone who wants a big screen that doesn't care if it is a smart tv. The shipper was fantastic it came in with not even a scratch on the box.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the TV
Reviews.Author: dlouhys
Reviews.Content: I have the same TV in the 40" model and I couldn't be happier.  Picture is great and it costs substantially less than the 3D/Smart TVs with the same screen.

Reviews.Title: Wide viewing angle and crisp picture make this TV well worth it
Reviews.Author: Jason Snyder
Reviews.Content: After updating settings to get rid of the dreaded "soap opera" effect, this has been a great TV. No issues with lighting or uneven blacks during the day or at night. My one downside is only having 2 HDMI inputs. Easily solved by installing a switch, but manufacturers should realize by now that in this day and age of everything HD and Blu-ray, 2 HDMI inputs are simply insufficient. Setup was a breeze as the Samsung UI hasnt changed much over the last couple of years. A top choice if you are on the standard TV market.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: MikeDiggity
Reviews.Content: Can't say anything bad about this tv, picture is great, sound is fine and the price was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: eus
Reviews.Content: Got this TV and when it first came there was a pixel out on it.  Amazon had to replace it (which ended up somewhat of a hassle due to their carrier) but when it finally came it was a great TV.  Great picture and very good for the money.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: N. Miranda
Reviews.Content: Great quality product for a good price. Slim and sleek. It pays to shop for deals. Samsung products have always lived up to the name in our household

Reviews.Title: Good but pic not as sharp as I expected
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Willette
Reviews.Content: Overall we are happy with this TV. Came when it was expected, easy delivery, however, the photo isn't as sharp as I expected. It may be our service which we are looking into but after reading other reviews it may be the TV.

Reviews.Title: A very good TV for our needs
Reviews.Author: Florida Native "Barbara"
Reviews.Content: The picture is clear and bright.  The TV worked well right out of the box and was relatively simple to hook up.  The TV is connected to cable box and a BluRay player.  I could wish for a manual explaining settings for picture color more clearly (with some studying the menus are understandable).  I could wish for more HDMI inputs, etc.  But when the price dropped around Black Friday I bought it and I have not regretted this at all.  My bluray player is network connected and has apps so I don't need this on the TV and I don't care to have webcams in my house, particularly with the security issues related to smart TVs that have been on the news lately.  This TV is a great choice for price and good picture.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas L. Iulg
Reviews.Content: So far I love it. Great picture easy set up, remote was easy to use in set-up, time, and any other adjustments needed. Also didn't need to buy any thing to set it up.I was really concern buying it on line, not knowing if I was doing the right thing spending $200.00 less then in local stores for 49 inch  screen and getting a 50 inch screen.  I would recommend this product to any one looking for a new TV.

Reviews.Title: 65 inch samsung
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the $.  I would tell anyone to buy it if they wanted a new big screen HDTV.  Little tricky setting it up for a good picture.  Im still tweaking it to get the best look possible.  Im getting close to the sweet picture my Sharp 46" LCD has.....but I do not think an LED will ever look as good as an LCD.  1080p always gets less crisp the bigger you go (make sure you remember this before you buy big).Channel switching to very fast....dark blacks and deep colors.  I am very happy with this HDTV.NFL PLAYOFFS!

Reviews.Title: Awesome HDTV
Reviews.Author: paradise city "techy person"
Reviews.Content: Samsung does not disappoint with picture quality, the choices of screen settings are the only point of contention, what settings are the best? Well just experiment until you second guess yourself that the optimal view is obtained. I would recommend Samsung from my experience.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for us!
Reviews.Author: shin lee
Reviews.Content: Clear and Great picture.  65 inch perfect for our house. Great price too, I got it on sale!First time buying TV from Amazon. Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: Its looks great
Reviews.Author: wolverlean
Reviews.Content: Even though the sound needs some help, I gave it a five star because it was expected with this LED 65 inch. Picture and design look great. Yes we will try to add on some speakers for movie's and music. Hope to keep that cost down.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Troy Sears
Reviews.Content: Was better than expected.  The picture is the best and great sound also.  I would recommend this TV.A++++ !

Reviews.Title: What I expected
Reviews.Author: MW
Reviews.Content: We already have a 55" Tv, same model, in the family room so I did some research and went to BB and looked at some other Tvs around the same price, but this one seemed to have the best picture imo. This Tv was going to be for the loft, mainly used for gaming and watching sports/movies so I considered some plasmas but the loft is relatively a bright room so I just couldnt convince myself to try a plasma. Also, this Tv had the lowest input lag compared to other Tvs around the same size/price. So I got this 50" model from BB the other day and have been playing BF4 on PS4. Ive been messing around with the settings and seeing what other people have done but I chose dynamic with some minor adjustments to other settings and the picture is great. I tried "Game Mode" but it looked terrible with BF4...maybe its better with some other games.ALSO the "Auto Motion Plus" is terrible with BF4. I tried all different settings with it, even custom, and they all look the same and they all created the blurred outline around the mini map and around the body when I would look down and run. But with AMP turned OFF all the blurriness went away. However, when watching ESPN, I switched AMP to the "smooth" setting and the info scrolling on the bottom of screen would scroll fine without any issues but with AMP turned OFF the words would struggle to move across the screen like they're supposed to. So Auto Motion Plus definitely makes a difference, for better or worse.The sound is alright, I have it set on Movie, but it still leaves much to be desired. But I use my headset w/ 7.1 dolby to play games and watch movies so that isn't an issue for me. If your planning on putting this in your family room then you will definitely need to invest in a surround sound system, at the very least get a soundbar and woofer.

Reviews.Title: Great value without a lot of the extras I didn't need.
Reviews.Author: Brad Jones
Reviews.Content: Good value.  Don't need a bunch of HDMI inputs if you have a receiver or Xbox one with pass through.  Didn't need smart capabilities either with all the other devices connected with Netflix and other things.

Reviews.Title: Great tv with Krystal clear picture
Reviews.Author: Mandy Faucette
Reviews.Content: Clear picture, easy to hook up and light weight. I went from a 42 inch to a 50 inch. What a difference it makes. I would recommend this tv. We have 2 other Samsung TV's in our home. They are good tv's.

Reviews.Title: Love our Samsung
Reviews.Author: Debra L. Adams
Reviews.Content: We love our new tv.  It is so clear, it is like looking thru a window and it was very easy to install & hook up.

Reviews.Title: Worh the money
Reviews.Author: Oliver
Reviews.Content: Excellent Big Screen TV with a reasonable price and whole family love it. Even without Smart function, we bought media box and connected so it has smart function too.

Reviews.Title: A good tv
Reviews.Author: Patrick Sandlin
Reviews.Content: the picture is good I think it could be a little better it has a lot of purple in it no matter what I do or adjust but all in all a good tv.

Reviews.Title: Excellent  Product
Reviews.Author: John Oliveira
Reviews.Content: Minutes to set up.  Resulting picture is fabulous (by my 85 year old  20/20 eyes!)  Attaching a set of Seinheisser phones enhanced the fine sound quality. Amazon's courteous  service is outstanding..as always

Reviews.Title: One of my favorite impulse purchases!!!
Reviews.Author: Zacerton
Reviews.Content: Bought it at Best buy on a Black Friday deal for $999 and I love it! I was little dissapointed that it wasn't a smart TV so I purchased a Roku to remedy that and I think I came out ahead. Great pircture, decent sound (just picked up a Sony sound bar and sub and I'm really happy with the set up), looks great playing xbox or watching a movie. Completely satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great set
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Demosi
Reviews.Content: This TV is everything one would expect from Samsung. The picture is sharp and crisp and with the 240 CMR there is not any blurring on fast scenes. The sound is good and I would highly recommend this TV for anyone looking for a 50" size.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sindhu
Reviews.Content: I bought this 50" LED TV directly from Amazon.com. It's a great TV, promptly packaged & delivered within a day!!! I had a 26" Philips Tube which I replaced with this TV. So obviously this looks way better than the tube. Quality of picture is great. It handles fast movement & action very well. I have sunlight in my living-room and I don't see any glare on the TV screen, so I'm quite pleased with that.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 50 inch LED TV is a pleasure
Reviews.Author: Pam L. Young
Reviews.Content: Great Buy and delivered on time.  I had a little trouble hooking up my older DVD player as there wer no instructions and the colors did not match.  Would really appreciate more hookup options (outlets) for WII game though...I replaced my 22 year old Mitsubishi 40 inch Projection TV so this picture of course is a great improvement...wow HD is awesome.....

Reviews.Title: This TV is great!
Reviews.Author: Justin M. Wadsworth
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect for video games and watching television/movies in HD. No lag in video games, actually brings out the colors in the game for a beautiful picture! The blacks on this TV are excellent but not as deep as the TV's that cost a little extra. 2 HDMI inputs is really all I need right now, but I might have to figure something out since I'll be purchasing the PS4 to compilment my Xbox at the end of the year. The sound projected from the TV is awesome with a multiple modes like Movie, simulated surround, etc. I have the TV on a stand though I am looking to mount it to the wall in the future. All in all a satisfied customer.Pros: Great picture, good for video games, easy to carry, quality for price.Cons: Only 2 HDMI inputs, TV-stand leans the TV on a slight angle.Also make sure you order through Amazon instead of a third-party. The company I purchased this TV through delivered it to my door and left it outside on my porch. I live on a main street of my city so theft isn't a huge concern but I would feel better had it been delivered with Amazon's white-glove delivery.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great deal, shipped with no problems
Reviews.Author: LizzieDaugh
Reviews.Content: This replaced another Samsung flat screen and I still love the brand. I didn't want a Smart TV (or to pay the extra they cost). This doesn't have a lot of extra space for HDMI hook-ups, much to my son's dismay, but I didn't get it for gaming. It arrived in perfect shape and for me it was a bonus that much of the packaging is environmentally friendly -- not so much styrofoam. I purchased the Square Trade protection plan and don't know how that will pan out but it was cheaper and for longer than programs at Best Buy or other stores like that. Hopefully I will not need to use it.It took a lot of playing with the picture settings to get the motion/frame rate jerky issues straightened out. I did it the hard way but I would suggest looking up online recommendations for settings -- there are many out there but they are independent, not supplied by Samsung. Pretty easy to find with a search though.

Reviews.Title: Great flat screen
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Denney
Reviews.Content: This flat screen has a beutiful picture sound is better than I expected .You have to play with the picture some , but what TV don't you.

Reviews.Title: Problem free so far
Reviews.Author: frederick l. england
Reviews.Content: Great picture.  Like that it is light weight and less power user than previous plasma set.  Took some time to get familiar with controls.  Users manual could be better.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a few weeks now and it is just amazing. I didn't think the sound would be too great for it being an LED TV but it is pretty decent as well. I definitely recommend this TV if you are looking to upgrade!

Reviews.Title: Best T.V for the price
Reviews.Author: JOSEPH DE LOUISA
Reviews.Content: This T.V is the clearest, Bright and awesome.Was watching a surf comp and i almost got wet lol.easy to use and amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Old Broads Riding Club"
Reviews.Content: This TV exceeded my expectations.  Because I'm not "techy" the few things the others wrote about don't bother me.  The picture and sound are easily changed and we found the one best for us.  I haven't tried any of the advanced things like putting in the memory stick, etc. as I don't seem to have time for that yet.  It fits well in our medium sized room and the sound is nearly surround sound right out of the box.  The only downside is we seem to be watching more TV since we got it because it's so clear and the colors are phenominal.

Reviews.Title: I love this 65 inch samsung
Reviews.Author: David H. Adkins
Reviews.Content: this is a gtreat tv for us. it has lived up to every thing we wanted. I don't care for the sound speakers being in the rear of the tv it does distort the sound. we cured it by buying a set of TV ears.they work great now we have great sound to go with our great picture.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding quality and value
Reviews.Author: daveb
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how good Samsung TV's are, and the value is terrific!  I have purchased 4 Samsung TV's in the past, and all are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Value - Great picture - just what i wanted
Reviews.Author: JRA
Reviews.Content: Great picture! Everything seems so real. Definitely worth the money and not having to bring it home in my small car.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV
Reviews.Author: RxDr
Reviews.Content: This is beautiful! I got it on sale Black Friday and have not had any problems with it! The USB port is an amazing feature and all the other ports work great too! The picture is sharp and the TV just looks great in my living room. The only issue I had was with the shipping company, they had to schedule a delivery (which is fine and understood) but because I wasn't available the day they wanted (middle of the day on a Wednesday) they said they couldn't deliver it for another week! Needless to say I went to the warehouse to pick it up and never plan on using them for personal items again! But the TV rocks!

Reviews.Title: A good value for the money
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: This is a no nonsense product that delivers a good value now that it is selling out at a discount.  The picture is excellent, though the sound leaves something to desire.

Reviews.Title: Five Star!
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV!  Samsung is top quality as always, and this is my fourth one.  And I will be buying more.

Reviews.Title: Excellent bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We're very pleased with this TV:  good picture, good sound, easy to use with DVD or VCR, can rotate screen as needed.

Reviews.Title: great blacks for 65"
Reviews.Author: G. Lai
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture. great blacks.very easy to tweak if you need to but i found not much needed.2 hdmi but enough since most who are serious about tv has a receiver.Ihave it paired with an Onkyo receiver, the higher end ones and looks great.only minor con is with playstation, when i select for example netflix, it loses the hdmi signal momentarily so the tv kicks out a message to the screen that it has lost connection...few seconds later the screen comes on with netflix.same thing when i switch to vudu on the ps3. over time, the message has become so common you tune it out mentally.but aside from that,for a 65" tv, can't beat it for the price.i waited for 3 months before amazon had it back in stock and snapped it up.those koreans know how to make those panels...even sony buys there panels from samsung, at a mark up...no wonder sony tv's are going to be a thing of the past soon...they just can't compete with price/quality.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 65 inch TV.  Great!!!
Reviews.Author: suzanne lapora
Reviews.Content: I just love my new TV . It has a great picture and the sound is great too. I have to say I was a bit worried about ordering such an item over the Internet ,but I can see now that its been a very worth while experience . Everything turned out the way  they described . Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture, bad stand
Reviews.Author: Ryan Sapel
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is amazing. My previous TV had only 720 P and going to this TV was a major upgrade. The first blu-ray I watched was incredible. It almost felt like it was 3D because the picture was so sharp and I felt like I was there. My only complaint is the stand isn't that well put together. There are about 8 screws that you have to use but they would not all go in flush after several attempts. The TV leans forward a couple of degrees but nothing to bad.

Reviews.Title: So far so good. It is a good TV with good picture and sound.
Reviews.Author: Sebring Guy
Reviews.Content: We both love it so far and are happy we bought it. It was very easy to get up and run. I love the remote....very intuitive and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: Don Whitwood
Reviews.Content: Have a great 47" Samsung 3 d led but bought a fireplace from Sam's and the 47" looked small so got the 65" non smart TV. I will never buy another smart TV got the roku and it is better than any smart TV. First TV came with a broken screen but Amazon was great and had another one on its way the same day and I got it in time for the Super Bowl used the set up some of the people recommended and the picture is awesome.

Reviews.Title: nice picture... finally
Reviews.Author: Krisk
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time getting a nice picture but it turns out that we had an extra cable attached and were not receiving an HD signal.  We called samsung customer assistance a few times and they were great.  I am still having a hard time getting the color right (some pictures it looks great, others are washed out) but I think we will figure that out.  If you are looking at this at best buy, make sure you check the price on Amazon.  best buy is selling it for $899 and we got a price adjustment to Amazon's listed price which was $847.  Overall, this seems like a nice tv and a good value.

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV
Reviews.Author: CH
Reviews.Content: This is a very good TV. I would have given it a 5 star if it had at least 1 more HDMI input. The small frame enhances the picture at the mercy of the speakers which is ok when hooked up to external speakers. Price is good also giving up internet. Internet can be found through less expensive resourses.

Reviews.Title: First HDTV
Reviews.Author: Jane L. "Jane"
Reviews.Content: Visio HD Ready some 40 odd inch TV was my old TV.  I am not much of a TV person so I can't really discuss specs but I am very happy with this TV.  HDTV is a cultural shock! WOW

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Beltsland960
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace a 40" Samsung LCD and the difference is amazing.  I thought my Blu-ray movies were sharp and crisp before, but on this TV - WOW!  It looks like you can reach into the picture. Set up was a snap - dvr, blu-ray player and apple tv in less than 20 minutes I was watching tv again.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the $$
Reviews.Author: RobertB
Reviews.Content: So far so goodI bought this TV because it has a superior picture in a bright over light room.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: tom h
Reviews.Content: great tv, excellent picture and features.  price was good.  easy to use.  it was delivered as promised, set up and checked.  i would definitely buy samsung products through amazon again.

Reviews.Title: Good value for a 55"
Reviews.Author: J. Zadi
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the value that I got for this tv but it is not the greatest tv I have ever seen. I have found that the whites are often too washed out and the darks are not truly dark. There are plenty of settings to play with to get these just right but frankly their are almost too many for an average user to understand and use effectively. Their is no reason why these settings are not preset from the factory. In addition, the tv arrives in power save mode which makes everything look dark. That setting is fairly easy to change and once it is changed the screen is MUCH brighter. Overall I am very pleased for the amount that I paid.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product
Reviews.Author: M. Kathryn
Reviews.Content: This TV is a replacement for our 50" Samsung DLP purchased in early 2004.  Loved the DLP, but this surpasses it by far.  Crisp clear picture.  Outstanding!  Because we have a Blu-Ray player, we do not need the Smart TV features and do not particularly care for 3D effects, so this was the perfect choice for us.

Reviews.Title: Great Price, great TV
Reviews.Author: midohtree
Reviews.Content: Very sharp piucture, outstanding color.  1st one sent to me kept shuttiung off, but this one works perfect so far

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Roger Oliver
Reviews.Content: This tv was great and shipped in record time.  The picture quality is superb.  I've always had good luck with Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sleepergirl
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN50EH6000 50-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black)I ordered this TV online on Tuesday night. I was very happy with the price as I was able to get it for $200 less than I'd have paid for it in the store (including store sales tax). It left the seller on Wednesday but didn't make it out of California until Thursday evening. FedEx delivered it to my home in Alabama on Saturday afternoon so I'm VERY HAPPY with delivery time.Several have complained about the sound. Yes, standard sound is a little lacking. Movie mode sound is much better but I'll probably get a sound bar to use while watching movies.I like that it's not a smart TV. My elderly mother lives with me and I was afraid if I bought a smart TV, there'd be a greater likelihood that she'd get the TV on an app screen or something similar while I was at work and wouldn't be able to watch her usual TV channels until I got home and reset it.The colors are great. I haven't tweaked the picture settings yet. I might play with it a little but I like that there's a way to return the TV to default settings in case I get everything messed up. It's great now, but I know the picture will look even better once I add HDTV in the near future.I love that the bezel around the TV is so thin. I have friends whose TV has a bezel about 3 inches thick and I think it is rather distracting.Overall I think this is a great TV. I'd buy it again and also recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Excellent flat screen tv for a bargain price!
Reviews.Author: Bradford Core
Reviews.Content: We have been waiting to purchase an excellent quality 50" flat screen tv for under $1,000.00 and this is it. We are most satisfied.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Steve Albertson
Reviews.Content: i am very happy with the tv,picture is great and just the right size.will update if any problems in the future

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Philip
Reviews.Content: Great picture, great size for a large Great Room, great sale price from one of the best TV manufactureres.  Only 2 HDMI inputs could pose issues for some; Motion blur is more noticable on a large tv.

Reviews.Title: Decent upgrade
Reviews.Author: Simon F. Rodehn
Reviews.Content: I had the Mitsubishi 65 inch rear projection TV for the past 5 years and this is an improvement.The colors are more vibrant and the blacks are more distinct with greater contrast in the dark scenes than other TVs I have owned.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: For a really large TV this thing has a really good picture. The motion displays really good.Would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture!
Reviews.Author: Ivonne Warren "Master Hoshi"
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  The picture is fantastic, wide color rage and very bright.  The black level is dark and doesn't bleed.  Works very well with my PlayStation.  Because I have a AV Receiver, there is no need for extra inputs other than HDMI.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product - easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Mike1Texas "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Arrived exactly as promised.  I had absolutely no problems setting it up and am very pleased with the quality of the picture.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture
Reviews.Author: Margaret Shen
Reviews.Content: The picture quality from this TV is just awesome!The surround sound from the built in speakers are good too.Definately better picture quality than Sony.

Reviews.Title: Strongly recommend
Reviews.Author: GJ
Reviews.Content: Based on Amazon reviews I picked up this bad boy around Black Friday...we're very happy we did.  Having other LED 120hz tv's this one blows away competition.  I searched for proper settings to get best results and that's also made a huge difference.  We've played PS3, watched blu ray's etc and I couldn't ask for a better tv.  Colours pop and the black level is superior to other tv's I've viewed.  I wish they would have added another HDMI outlet (only 2) but not a huge deal.  Hooked up to the soundbar but the sound on the TV itself is not too bad.  Didn't really listen to it much.  Huge fan of Samsung now.

Reviews.Title: great if you can figure out the set up
Reviews.Author: SAT Bahai
Reviews.Content: we didn't want 3d because we wear glasses, and 3d glasses over glasses is not comfortable.  Some of the feedback on the smart tv is negative toward the apps so we decided to get this with a wifi blueray player.  this tv looks great but it took some time to adjust all of the options.  I tried to copy what some other reviewers suggested but with different lighting, room size, etc. I had to experiment.  Now i hope the power never goes out because I would loose everything.  Once everything is set up the picture and the sound is awesome.  the only knock is the tv does not automatically detect when the blueray turns on but that is minor.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Marleen F. Walaitis
Reviews.Content: Great TV and an adequate size for our family room.  Samsung makes a great product and should be used by everyone.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: R. Hohlman
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is so much better than on our old Samsung DLP that it almost seems phony. It really does take a while to get used to a picture that constantly looks like real life. Now if this TV lasts as long as the DLP model did (nearly ten years), then I would rate it at ten stars!

Reviews.Title: Strange dimensional aspect
Reviews.Author: Robert York "maintain_composure"
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to use this set for a week and a half now at a property I am renting in Florida. I honestly do not care for this set. Every show looks like a soap opera. Its weird looking. Others have said they were able to spend weeks tweaking the settings to overcome this strangeness. I have not seen anything like this on sets from other manufacturers.  I don't like it and I personally would not buy this unit after experiencing it for an extended time.

Reviews.Title: Go for the large screen not the smart features
Reviews.Author: Wing
Reviews.Content: If you are a smart buyer like me :), you would want to spend your money on the screen size and the screen quality, not the so-called smart features which usually are just wifi connection plus some lame webpage. Because honestly, any digital set top box would blow most of the smart features out of the water. A good TV is here to stay in your living room for a good 3-6 years. The smart feature wont last that long (unless the manufacturer updates the firmware very diligently which we all know they wont.). Why spend money on something that evolve so quickly and can be brought for a much cheaper price?This 65inch samsung would just be the TV you look for in a TV. Let me tell you, for a TV, the top three feature you are looking for are screen, screen, screen. Screen is everything. First of all, size does matter. The bigger the screen the better! No matter how small your living room is. Go for the largest screen you can afford. The large screen will blow you away - guaranteed! Second, look for the screen with good contrast. The OLED screen always have the best contrast because the black is true black, not greyish black. Some people think plasma is better than OLED. I deeply and profoundly disagree. My previous TV from Panasonic is a plasma, the picture contrast is far far worse than the OLED screen.Overall, this TV strips out all the none sense feature and kept the most important features the best.The only complain I have is the number of HDMIs. Two HDMIs are not enough for any modern living room. A solution maybe to buy a HDMI switch (very economic solution) or buy a good AV receiver (a more costly solution but if you want to build home theater anyway this is the way to go).

Reviews.Title: Love Samsung Products
Reviews.Author: Daniel B.
Reviews.Content: I decided that I did not need a 3D or smart tv; I just wanted a great picture and that is what I got.  Viewing movies is a treat.  Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Love the TV!
Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: I really like the tv a lot.  Some people complained because of the banding.  I have very little banding.  Im not sure what the difference is though.  My version is the MH-01.  There are other panel versions

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: Rabbit
Reviews.Content: It's a great TV if you can get it on sale for around $1000 I gave it 4 stars because it has no buttons on it what so ever you need the remote for everything.  Also it only has 2 HDMI ports on the back and 1 USB port for a TV of this size I expect at least 3-4 HDMI ports.  The Picture is amazing and the sound is really good just make sure you download and install the firmwire update for this TV.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've owned.
Reviews.Author: Justin D Riordon
Reviews.Content: This TV is of exceptional quality! My first flat screen and I couldn't have made a better decision! I shopped around, paid attention to specs, and even bought a little more expensive TV to ensure I got the quality I was looking for. My video games and movies are outstanding!!!

Reviews.Title: Default firmware 1022, Samsung most recent is 1012.3 on website
Reviews.Author: Clinton Panday
Reviews.Content: The TV came default with a firmware of 1022 (bought Dec 2, 2013), it was recommended by Samsung to download the firmware on its website 1012.3. I did just that when it came right out of the box. I seems what I did was a downgrade and went to talk with one of Samsung's technicians. I was told there was no such firmware of 1022 and the most recent is 1012.3 which was dated on June, 2012. If it helps I have the version UN65EH6000F/FXZA with a Panel of YH02. Not sure if I can get 1022 firmware again but make sure to check on the TV current version before you perform an upgrade on the firmware.

Reviews.Title: Decent picture quality but, unnatural colors, bad judder, horrible gradient blending and back-light bleeding.
Reviews.Author: J. A. Torres
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the TV is going back regardless of the great deal I got for the 65" UN65EH6000 ($997.00). The colors especially red's and greens are unnatural no matter how much I try to calibrate them using my setting or those I find online. There is judder that will not go away regardless of auto-motion on or off or changing HDMI cables or content, this has happened on HDTV programming, HTPC HD, and Blu-ray. The blooming and gradient blending is horrible especially on grays and blacks. And lastly because off the back-light bleeding, 2 inch thick line that goes down both right and left side of the screen. Only way to even slightly relieve these issues is to bring down the brightness, gamma, back-light so low the picture is ridiculously dark and even then when you turn off your room lights it is still noticeable. The one good surprise was the off axis viewing which was a lot better than expected and the screen seems to be semi-matte. I have the YH-01 Panel Manufactured this year, don't remember the month. Oh well, next up Sony 70" KDL70R520A or the Sony KDL65W850A 65-Inch. Both will be quite a bit more expensive but hopefully you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Zoltan
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the picture quality of this TV! Definitely worth the money. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for good value.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but not up to Plasma standards for viewing from side
Reviews.Author: OBX Ron
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV to replace and old Hitachi plasma that had the input panel destroyed by lightning.This Samsung LED/LCD has a GREAT picture up to the plasma standard when viewed directly head on or from up to a 45-60 degree angle ..............but MY chair is at a 60+ degree angle to the screen and the picture washes out significantly and to a very obvious difference to the "ancient" plasma TV.  This deficit is most noticeable with non HD programs and better with HD after adjusting black background lighting, contrast and brightness settings.So my 4 star review is meant to show that the overall picture is really nice but don't expect much at angles over 60 degrees although still acceptable with HD programs...........unfortunately you cannot discover this in the store where they soup up the contrast, brightness and black screen to mask these deficiencies and where everything looks TOO good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture and Value
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: There are hundreds of detailed reviews on the Samsung EH6000 series available for you discussing specs, calibration and users impressions. I wanted to summarize some points from my experience and observations.o I highly recommend this HDTV for the value and the picture it provides. The physical appearance and quality are top notch.o The UN50EH6000 has an awesome full-array LED backlit picture that provides a great viewing experience with bright and vivid colors.o You MUST calibrate the television to get best picture customization to your personal preferences.o The infamous "soap opera" effect can be disabled. When enabled the picture has a surreal almost 3-D look that makes the characters pop out on the screen. It takes some getting used to but can be very interesting viewing experience.o The set has very basic features, only 2 HDMI inputs, not 3-D and not a smart TV. You will need to spend more to obtain the additional features. This entry level TV can provide much enjoyment if you don't need all the extras.Samsung makes a great product. I am personally a big fan of SONY however the SAMSUNG is a better value on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: More than I Expected!!
Reviews.Author: Lillian P Clemons
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV. My only dissatisfaction is that it does not have an anti-glare screen.  My old TV had the anti glare screen and I loved it. Other than this it is an excellent buy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Adam Fornal
Reviews.Content: The picture on the TV is amazing.  This is a great TV at an affordable price.  Everything was easy to setup and get started.  The base is very small, but somehow it is able to support the large screen.  I would recommend this TV to others.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV
Reviews.Author: Macomb,MI.8706
Reviews.Content: Light weight, easy to set up, backlit remote, easy to navigate menu, speakers sound good, definitely recommend. You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Flutie
Reviews.Content: Had a Westinghouse - about 7 yrs. old and it died.  I had noticed that my other family members had Samsungs and the picture was so much better.  We love it.  It is the best.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture!
Reviews.Author: Jo40788
Reviews.Content: This TV has a life like picture and really is amazing. I also like the size which allows me to fit it in a tight space due to the smaller frame size.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Leslie Q. Knight
Reviews.Content: Set up was relatively easy considering we have an xbox and a home theater system. Deep blacks and vivid color. It's almost better than real life!

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Matthew Meade "Squirrel"
Reviews.Content: This TV is one of the best TVs that I have ever owned. The picture quality from this is so profound that it will take some time to get used too, so understand that before you worry.

Reviews.Title: Who needs 3D or Smart TV's?
Reviews.Author: Boca Buyer
Reviews.Content: I received this TV and it was well packed in the shipping container with no dents or tears.  The unpacking was simple and we set the TV up in no time.  I used the picture settings suggested by others in Amazon reviews and the picture is nothing short of stunning.  I do find it strange that some settings are grayed out for HDMI #1, but I plugged my HDMI into #2 and everything worked perfectly.  I use a Samsung blu-ray player for the smart hub and streaming from Netflix and Hulu Plus so have no need to pay $500 extra for that to be built into the TV.  We also have the Samsung receiver, so our sound couldn't be better . . . I can't really say how the TV sound would be without the separate speaker system.If you're in the market for a 65" TV and don't care about smart TV or 3D, then the UN65EH6000 is the one for you.  I should also mention that if you live near a Brandsmart store, they have this model on closeout for $1,299 . . . just try to beat that price for a brand new 65" Samsung TV . . . no open box, no refurbished stuff.

Reviews.Title: Less Than Perfect
Reviews.Author: F. Woodard
Reviews.Content: The picture is not too bad,  but on some types of programs it is quite pixellated when showing black backgrounds. Samsungs always seem to have the best pictures of all brands when viewed in the big box stores.But my Vizio and Toshiba looks better than this tv.However, it does not have that overly soap opera effect of a Vizio. Maybe it has something to do with the size because my daughter's 55 inch Samsung has a better picture than my 65 inch. If I had it to do all over again I would've settled for a 60 inch. The NFL and NBA games do look great in HD, and some movies too. It's not a terrible tv but it's just not quite as good as I thought it would be. To eleminate most of the pixelation I went to Picture Options and set Digital Noise Filter to Off and set Auto Motion Plus to Clear. The dark backgrounds look a lot better now.''

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Jf
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV over the slimer versions because it is completely back lit opposed to the edge lit with all of their clouding and flashlighting. I love the picture quality on this set and havent had any banding issues. This is my first TV purchase online and I can say I would do it again. When delivered you get to inspect it and make sure it is in perfect condition. Also they call and schedule your delivery day to make sure you are there.

Reviews.Title: PERFECTO
Reviews.Author: Juan Borjas
Reviews.Content: el mejor televisor que alguien puede tener a ese precio , recomiendo al 100%. .. ... . . . .

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Luke Eveland
Reviews.Content: Picture is crystal clear like your actually there and not just watching. Very user friendly.I am very satisfied!!! You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 65" Led
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I've looked at 65" Samsung and 70" Sharp 732 Aquos. Both TVs are great. What I felt was that 2.5" per side smaller screen wasn't a big enough size difference and price, was the reason my choice was Samsung. I have the TV on a stand not mounted on the wall. This works best for us, as you know it weighs about 85lb and is 3" thick. This would require a sturdy wall mount.The TV is flawless and a joy to watch.

Reviews.Title: This tv is proof God exists
Reviews.Author: Caleb
Reviews.Content: It's a bad ass tv. What else can you say? Looks awesome. I have never had a led tv, and it seems kinda flimsy, but I guess that's the point, right?  So, great tv!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Rain
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with our new tv. It's our bedroom tv, and it has such a vivid picture. Good buy at a great price. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: Best T.V for us
Reviews.Author: Rusty
Reviews.Content: We love this t.v.  The picture quality is perfect and we love the features.  We didn't need some of the high tech. stuff that comes on some of the t.v.'s.  It is a little more basic but perfect for our use.I would recommend this t.v to anyone.

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Author: Justine
Reviews.Content: so far I love it. It has a Great picture and the sound is good. Its hard to get used to looking at a clear screen. Everything looks so real

Reviews.Title: Samsung Products
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Frain
Reviews.Content: Everything we expected from this product! Very happy with our product choice! Will order similar product in the future for sure.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Beamer
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv. I would have given a five star review if it wasn't so difficult to set the picture options. Now that I have the picture set to my liking the HD channels are perfect. It took me forever to set them right though. When I first set up the tv the default factory settings are all set to auto. The picture was very artificial and it actually hurt my eyes and made me feel nauseous.Anyway I googled the issue and it seemed that a lot of people were having the same issues.The recommendations were unanimous. Shut off all the auto pictures option and put everything on manual control. Upon doing this the picture was perfect. Do the same for the speakers. To many gadgets actually make technology worse. Don't get me wrong I think technology is great but sometimes to much of a good thing is not so good.  Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Need more inputs
Reviews.Author: Chris Jarman
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price!  I would have given this TV a 5 star rating if it had more inputs.  I have no idea why Samsung would put so few on it??  Be wary if you still have equipment that uses Composite or Component, as it only has one!!

Reviews.Title: Got overcharged then the TV didnt....
Reviews.Author: K. Mason Oklahoma City
Reviews.Content: I purchased on black Friday.  Was charged 227$ more than the advertised price.  Had to call amazon then the company that sold on Amazon, finally they agreed to match the price that was listed on Amazon when it was purchased (geez way to go all out) and said give it 2-3 days to post refund.  3 weeks later had to call discover to have them reverse the 227$ as refund was never sent, haven't heard back anything yet  Hooked it up and the middle of the screen had a back light image problem.  Called Samsung they sent repair TV, as service man was at the house he unpacked the replacement screen and it was damaged.  Ordered another one and a week later finally I have a TV that works.  Now as far as the TV itself I am happy with, but as far as the whole ordeal, saving a few hundred dollars but having to deal with all this other stuff doesn't seem worth it to me.  Next time ill buy locally.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture... but ...
Reviews.Author: Mike Aylstock
Reviews.Content: ... the TV only had two HDMI slots in the back.  It was my fault for asuming there would be many more like my older Samsung.  I will be more careful next time.  Thanks to Best Buy, I have everything connected now ... but it was a pain.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 65" TV for price, with caveats
Reviews.Author: Isehara "isehara2"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after buying a 65"ES8000 (returned twice) and an 60" ES7500 (excellent). I paid 1700 for this and I think that it is a reasonable purchase. As with all Samsungs the picture is very reasonable, especially for movies. This is a limited full array TV, unlike all the other Samsungs which are edge lit. So it is a little thicker than for example the ES7500. It may be 3" in thickness.  The positives are a nice picture, a nice price for a 65". It has less clouding/flashlighting and to me the black levels are better than the edge-lit Samsungs. However it definitely has some of these same issues also. My guess is that the Sharp Elite and the Sony are better in this regard. However you are paying 3 - 4 times more for these latter two TV's.  The negatives are mainly that this TV has a lot of banding, during any scene where the camera rapidly pans right to left. This is seen when (especially) watching soccer or in some movie scenes. I had this problem with 2 65" ES8000 and 2 65" EH6500. I returned this TV once and the second one also had the same problem. That means 4 Samsung 65" have the same banding problems. I assume and have read that all 65" have this problem to some extent, even the sony 950.  The bottom line is that the picture is a nice bright one on most scenes, and the price is very reasonable. My plan is to use this for a few years, then upgrade to a 4K one once that technology becomes better developed and cheaper. For my purposes this is an excellent TV to act as a bridge until the arrival of 4K. If you have to have the perfect 65" TV now then I would suggest another brand or the new F series from Samsung. I did not trust the F series initially after my experience with the ES series last year, which I believe Samsung put on the market with insufficient testing.  If you want a 60" then I suggest the 60ES7500 - this is an excellent TV as per my review. For 65" I would either go with this TV or risk the new 2013 F series. I prefer to wait at least 6 months after a new TV is released, so that any problems and complaints come out.

Reviews.Title: A++
Reviews.Author: Kyle R.
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny! Great picture quality, extremely lower energy usage (e.g. $11 annual cost), light as a feather for mounting onto the wall. Completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Unimpressive....Returned
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I bought this television as a replacement for a returned Samsung 6500 series television that was a DUMB I mean Smart T.V. My thinking was Samsung has lightyears to go before their Smart televisions are ready for prime time so the next best thing would be to get the same television but without the Smart features. Good idea, right? Wrong. This television was terribly unimpressive from the picture to the thickness of the actual television. Even After I had the settings configured to what others deemed "the best," it was still unimpressive. I'm neither a pictohphile nor an audiophile but I found myself believing that the picture quality was no better than an LCD of the same size. Not to mention the stand in which the television is mounted to does not rotate so if you need to angle your television in a particular way you have to physically pick it up and rotate it. I just returned it and decided to go with a different brand. If Samsung ever wants my money they're going to have to step up their game because the current product is unsatisfactory and not worth the $800. This being my second returned Samsung television I'm hoping I have better luck with the next one that's not Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Vonzo
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is pretty good.  I'm not a huge fan of LCD.  My plasma blows this out of the water but I have this TV in a well lit room and plasma just doesn't work in there.  The colors appear true to me and the screen is nice and bright.  Action is smooth to my untrained but discerning eyes and that's with the 120Hz turned off.  I absolutely hate the 120Hz settings on this thing.  I fully understand what they mean by soap opera effect now.  120Hz makes this look horrific on scripted shows, reality TV and movies on DVD.  I don't notice any improvement switching from 60 to 120Hz on sports.  That's a good thing because I don't want to have to constantly change the setting depending on what I'm watching.  We leave the smooth motion or whatever it's called feature turned off and are happy with the TV.  This is our second unit.  The first turned itself off after about 2 months and would not turn back on.  I called Amazon and they got me a new one in 2 days.  2 days!!!  Hopefully that was just a bad unit and this new one will last a long time.  Thanks to Amazon for excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: a little bit confusing on the set-up
Reviews.Author: Rick O'Rourke
Reviews.Content: Samsung needs a better explanation on their set-up and their foldout instruction sheet, not too happy with that. Having a bit of a problem with a fuzzing effect with the writing on the screen, might be a problem with my cable HD, going to check on that.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: nick
Reviews.Content: Was just what I expected. Haven't had any issues with it. Great color and love The USB port. A a

Reviews.Title: Best Buy
Reviews.Author: Christopher F. Ransom "PAYNE"
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV from best buy for 700$ live the picture. I want a TV without apps remote sucks

Reviews.Title: Great television; especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: SMinSD
Reviews.Content: My dad had a gift card given to him to use at a major electronic retailer, but the price on Amazon was so much less that it was worth it to pay all of it through Amazon. All is fine - the gift card is not FRY'd. He can still use it for something else as long as they can been Amazon's price!Yes, the television was purchased for use in a home of 70+ year-olds (my dad and his wife), so this one worked great for them. Otherwise, I would think someone wanting a television in an area that is not used primarily for watching tv, this would be great. I always purchased another brand until about 4 years ago when I discovered Samsung. I love their televisions. Just make sure you get what you need in your television viewing - Samsung will carry it. Don't pay more if it is paying for things you'll never even notice.My dad is thrilled with it. Great quality HDTV!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: I. Hosein "Life is what you make it"
Reviews.Content: Just right for us. Didn't want one too expensive and also was skeptical of a 3D TV in terms of the lifespan so this one is great. Smart TV's get a little complicated for the older folks in the house anyway.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: poormike
Reviews.Content: I chose five stars because the quality of the merchandise is pretty good , I like the good quality and the low price and will recommend this product to every one.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: kylesm
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from a 42" SD TV to this HDTV about a month ago and we are still blown away by the image quality. You will not be disappointed, the image is very crisp. The bevel is certainly not the smallest on the market and the stand is not the sleekest design, but for the Amazon price, I can't complain about that too much.

Reviews.Title: Beat all local prices and is wonderful.
Reviews.Author: jordsmom3061
Reviews.Content: My large screen tv died suddenly and I was in the market for an HD tv.  I prefer LED and my wall unit could only take at 50".  I have a 55" Samsung in my bedroom.  Also, it's only 60Hz instead of 120 and the difference is subtle but there.I called, checked online, etc., all of my local stores and did my comparison shopping.  Since I wasn't mounting this tv but just setting it in my wall unit, no additional hardware or installation was needed.  Just wanted to get delivery.  Pick-up was a nice feature from my local stores but the price couldn't compare and this shipped fast and came in perfect condition.  Set-up was a breeze and my local waste company doesn't charge for curbside delivery so my husband put the dead set on the curb on the day we were told it would be picked up.The two brands of LED tv's that seem to always be the best in all types of reviews are Samsung and Sony (Bravia or better).  My dentist purchased Samsung monitors for all of his exam rooms and I asked if he was happy with them and he gave me a resounding yes!Excellent tv, great price, great delivery schedule, no shipping fees... just an easy experience and a great product.A quick note on installation:  when I purchcased my 55" tv I also purchased a swiveling wall mount and called local electricians and asked if they would due a wall mount with an outlet, etc.  I found someone who does tv installs on the side and he was less than half the price of the installation price offered by the stores.  Check before you buy and, if no installation is needed, definitely check out amazon's prices vs the stores.

Reviews.Title: We love this HDTV.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased this 65" TV on sale at BestBuy in November (after black friday) for $1500.  It was the last day of the sale so we purchased it in haste.  It only has 2 HMDI connections, no SmartTV, and no 3D.  We were fine without these options, since we only needed to connect cable and Apple TV.  We needed to get a fairly large TV because where we wanted to mount the TV would be pretty far from the seating area.  BB didn't have the 65" on display but we were impressed with the 55" that was on display.Note: this is the first time getting an HDTV with HD programming from cable or uverse.  We had a Sony KF-60WE610 HDTV before this, but we never purchased the HD package from Uverse.  We just switched to Comcast when getting this TV.The picture is great and after using the settings that F.Maria (reviewer here on amazon), it made it even more to our taste.  The colors are vibrant, it's not too bright or not too dark.  The contrast and the black levels are to our liking.  Watching HD channels is GREAT!!!!  I have no idea why we never made the jump to HD sooner.As far as sound, as long as you not an audiophile, I think what this set can produce should be sufficient.  We purchased a sound bar thinking that this TV probably has some really small speakers, but we soon found out that the TV's sound performed very good without one.At first, we were planning on returning the TV because there was slight vertical banding that is noticeable while watching sports.  I was really annoyed that it was there, but we really enjoyed this TV so much that I started not to care that the banding was there.The remote control wasn't that hard to use.  However, we programmed the Comcast remote so we don't even use the Samsung remote anymore.So we had the TV for a few months, and had some friend and their son come over to play with our son.  An accident happened where a kid toy was flung towards the TV and cracked the screen.  It was pretty bad.  Had a Samsung tech come over, and they said It would have cost more to replace/fix than what we paid to purchase the TV.  Luckily I was able to find the same TV here on Amazon, USED from Blinq, for less than $1300.We got this TV and it barely even looked used.  Turned it on, and there was no Vertical banding on this one. The picture and sound was great.  I really can't complain about anything with this new/used TV we just received.If you are looking for a big set, this TV would be idea. Especially if you can find it on sale, or even used.  I would definitely recommend this TV to a friend.There was a little vertical banding that is noticeable while watching football, baseball, and soccer.  The colors, brightness, etc looked kinda off.  I did research on some settings and found one

Reviews.Title: At the right price, 5 stars!
Reviews.Author: Tsur
Reviews.Content: So the first one came damaged. Amazon quickly shipped a replacement. I'm thrilled that they resolved it so rapidly. But, the box the 2nd TV came in is simply ridiculous. The 50" TV came in a ginourmous box stuffed to the gills with packing peanuts. I'm not exaggerating when I say that a 65" television would comfortably fit in the 2nd box. How am I possibly supposed to recycle all of this cardboard?The television itself is awesome. It's replacing a six year old 40" Samsung LNT4061F that got damaged. I promised myself that I would never buy a Samsung again after I had to replace the capacitors on my LNT4061F. It really annoyed me that Samsung would use such cheap components. In fact, I had every intention of buying a 50" Panasonic Plasma VT50 or VT60. The VT50 was on sale at Best Buy for $1000. I went with the intention of picking it up, but the glare from the screen was just too much. This TV sits in the living room lit by at least 1-3 three windows depending on the time of day. The VT50 display was stunning, but the glare made it completely unusable in my environment.A Samsung LED LCD was on display too. The picture wasn't as nice, but it wasn't nearly as reflective. I made note of the model and purchased a Samsung UN50EH6000 from Amazon for $739. The colors out of the box were truly bizarre. The motion was really funky too. Hats off to CNET for giving me some quick settings to base mine off of. Now tweaked, I'm completely satisfied with the colors, blacks, and the motion. Side by side, the new Samsung has a MUCH better picture than the old Samsung. I guess that's to be expected. I'm a little disappointed that I didn't get plasma quality, but the truth is, I never had any issues with the old Samsung's picture quality and the new one is so much better. What I am I complaining about?Okay, I do have a couple of tiny complaints. The blacks are not as deep or nuanced as I would like. Consequently, during dark scenes, things look a little muddy. It's not bad, but just not as good as the very best. The screen, while matte, is definitely more reflective than my old Samsung.I think it's bunk that people are complaining about the lack of HDMI ports. It's clearly stated before you purchase the TV.  Two HDMI and the composite suit my needs, if it didn't, I wouldn't have purchased it.Inexplicably, the price of this TV is now $949. I don't think I'd pay that much for it. At $739 I felt I was getting a good deal. At $949 I'd shop for something else. Maybe the cost of the humungous second box drove up the price $200?  It's only been a little bit, but for $739 this is a five star TV. For $949 I think you can do better and I'd only give it four stars.I feel like I've taken a real gamble buying another Samsung after my first one was of such shoddy build. Hopefully I won't get burned.EDIT:After a couple weeks of usage I've notice something, this TV is a DUST MAGNET. I've never seen any other object collect more dust. The screen seems normal enough, but the gloss plastic frame and stand collect huge amounts of dust. Admittedly, I'm not the best house keeper. But the entertainment center the TV rests on is dust free. I wonder if a matte plastic finish would attract less dust.

Reviews.Title: Great 'machine'
Reviews.Author: Frank McGarry
Reviews.Content: Excellent performance- as advertised.  Samsung produces great productHave not mounted on wall yet-  but size would make this easy to do.

Reviews.Title: I was torn on whether to give it 4 or 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Tom
