Reviews.Content: First, I have to give props to Jason’s review for his settings adjustments.  The first blu-ray I watched on this was Prometheus, and that ‘soap opera’ effect was PAINFUL!  After changing the settings to Jason’s recommendations it looks much better.  I’m sure I’ll still be tweaking it further—certain scenes and commercials look washed-out, but then others appear great.5 stars for a great picture in a non-3D dumb-TV package.  Like so many others I just want to watch TV, movies, and play video games without all the apps of a smart-TV that I’d never use.  I also looked at the ES6100, but was only seriously considering that due to its thinness.  Since I’ll probably never wall-mount it I don’t even notice the EH6000 as being thick.Why I considered giving it four stars: limited number of inputs, notably the single shared composite/component input; my old set remembered the volume setting for each input, which was just one of those nice conveniences I got used to; and I’ve noticed some artifacting under certain conditions, though I’m not sure if blur or judder reduction or if something else is to blame (but this is rare and seems to be much better since changing the settings).In the end this set delivered what I wanted—a great picture at a reasonable price, and without all of the other features I would never use, anyway.

Reviews.Title: best big screen value
Reviews.Author: paul locher
Reviews.Content: beautiful picture, feature are ok, operation is good, some faced are a little washed out so i need to learn how to adjust it

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Millenwagon
Reviews.Content: After switching around some of the picture quality settings it got rid of the "soap opera effect" and is everything I wanted. Zero motion blur or ghosting while watching football or action movies. Unfortunetly There is no hockey this season so I can't comment on that aspect. Plug in your hard drive and watch it directly withouth an HDMI chord. This is great because my laptop is old and doesnt have that plug in or drains the laptop battery.Shipping was handled well but I could see where if it was handled bad where there could be issues.Also the stand could be a bit more supportive in my opinion. I don't think it will fall but it will wobble if you accidently move it.I would recommend this TV to anyone

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Big Poppy
Reviews.Content: Ended having to buy this at BB during a special sale for 1499. Thanks to the reviewer that posted the tweaks to the settings. The picture is awesome! You can't be this, it blows away my Panasonic LED.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Robert Wittenburg "hardbags dot com"
Reviews.Content: We are pleased with the tv. It has a great picture and a nice remote (very important) but I would have liked more HDMI inputs (it only has two) - had to buy a switcher so I can go from blue ray and/or computer to Directv. This is a big mistake in my opinion for Samsung to just put two. It has sparse inputs all around. I bet they save a whopping 5 dollars by not putting these extra inputs and I had to spend $80.00 to compensate. If you read the professional reviews, you'll see that the picture quality isn't so good when viewed from an angle. Not a problem for us since our viewing is pretty much right in front but might be an issue for other folks. I'm kinda wishing we'd stuck with with the Visio brand. We bought one first, a 55 inch, but it was too large for our room and decide to go down to a 50 inch and bought this Samsung because it was such a great price. Still, overall, we like the tv a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: tmjdog
Reviews.Content: SAMSUNG UN50EH6000 LED HDTV - Fantastic picture, terrific price ($780 or so), and mounted over the fireplace, with an Apple TV and a Blue Ray, this TV set up is first class.  And I literally spent thousands less than friends with a similar looking setup.  I already had a Phillips sound bar with subwoofer, and the sound bar sitting on the mantle under the TV hides the wiring, and looks and sounds great.  I used the picture settings suggested by others in Amazon reviews, and have been very pleased with the picture.As mentioned, I mounted the TV above the fireplace, but the mantle should deflect the heat enough to eliminate any temperature concerns.  I'll monitor that next winter, and adjust if I have to, but I'm not expecting problems.  And the hollow mantle and self adhesive corner wire covers (purchased at Best Buy) allow for a totally professional looking installation.  The wire covers can be painted to match your wall paint, and are not even noticeable.OK, nothing is ever perfect, so if I could do something different, what would it be?  I'd go bigger.  My two chairs that are most directly in front of the TV are 14 feet away.  I was concerned that the 55" or 60" would just appear a little too big for the brick wall over the fireplace, and the size of my den.  But I'm now convinced I should have gone bigger, even with the two side couches a little closer.  A great picture still needs to be viewed at the proper distance.  I can not over emphasize this.I know others have expressed a concern over just two HDMI ports on this TV.  Most sound systems have at least one HDMI input, and two HDMI outputs, so I connected the Directv directly to the TV, and the other port is connected to the sound system.  The Apple TV and Blue Ray are both connected to the sound system, so, if you have a sound system, no problem as far as I'm concerned.  And if you don't have a sound system, go get one, it makes a world of difference.  I bought mine for $99 at Sams a couple of years ago.Also, be sure to get "airplay" operational on your iphone.  You will be able to listen to any music, and view any pictures that you have on your iphone.  If you have a music subscription such as Rhapsody, like I do, you will literally have the entire universe of music on your TV.And one last comment.  Since Apple TV only cost $99, their 2 year warranty/technical assistance plan is only $29.00.  This is a pretty cheap way to have 24/7 technical assistance available to get everything working for the first few years.Very happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: question ( 1 ).  question ( 2 ).
Reviews.Author: Bobby Joyner
Reviews.Content: question ( 1 ), because I could.  honestly,  if there had been a half star, I would have chosen it because  "there ain't no tens".  each and all may be improved.  but this is a good one!!!!!!!!!!question ( 2 ). this is not my first Samsung product. I have and will continue to tell others of what  I have experenced.  and promote using Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: Missing screws
Reviews.Author: Xiang He
Reviews.Content: I received the TV without the 8 screws that are used to assemble the TV to the base. I had to wait for another month to get the screws. I did a search on internet and saw similar problems with Samsung TVs. I will hesitate to buy a Samsung TV next time.

Reviews.Title: Great for TV, not for MOVIES.
Reviews.Author: G. Christy "Quality Eyes"
Reviews.Content: There are great reviews on here. My experience is that the detail is awesome.We do not watch tv, so read this with that in mind. We love movies and dvds.For movies, we did not like how this looks like home video or 'soap opera' looks.We actually returned this Samsung in exchange for a Panasonic Plasma, TC-P50S60 50-Inch 1080p 600Hz HDTV. Now, we are thrilled with that regular movie viewing. Plus, the Panasonic has more options with ethernet hook in, etc.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Big TV
Reviews.Author: Lee of Seattle
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for anyone.  Many of my friends and family now want one similar to this TV.  I'm not a TV expert, but this is my experience so far.  Beautiful & bright picture.  This is a HD, back lit LED 120 Hz 65" TV, with motion rate 240 Hz.  I don't know what that means, but I guess it's the acceleration software?  I don't have blurry images with action shows.  I heard it may have blurry problems with high action video games.  I don't play those games.  Maybe someone else can provide that feedback.  I received this TV Dec 1, 2012 in time for all my Christmas parties.  It was easy to set up and started right up.  I used the TV stand for my TV.  The stand wobbles, but okay for my situation.  Some may want to use a wall mount bracket.  I have my TV set up with bluray player, HD satellite service and Xbox through a receiver.  Make sure to only use your HDMI connections from devices to TV.  That's the only way to get 1080p to show properly.  I highly recommend HD service for this TV.  You will have a low quality picture if you have standard cable or satellite service.  This TV has only two HDMI inputs.  I use a receiver so it works for me.  The Samsung UN65EH6000 is not a smart TV.  I do all my smart activities - streaming video, music & internet contents - through my wireless smart bluray player.  I didn't waste money doubling up on smart TV & smart bluray player (under $100).  Shop around, TV prices fluctuate a lot.  I got my TV under 2k.

Reviews.Title: Plain awesome
Reviews.Author: Isabelle
Reviews.Content: Just bought this 50 inch tv so I could put my older 42 inch plasma in my bedroom. Beautiful picture just like everyone says. I used the settings provided by one of the other reviewers and my picture is now pretty amazing.  You definitely need to play around with the picture settings to suit your taste. My living room is essentially outside (its all windows) so i had difficult time viewing my plasma. Too much glare. This LED tv is perfect if you have this problem. What a great buy and for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: HoustonDecorator
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a LG LCD that went bad in a little over a year. I have been very pleased with the picture.  The Dynamic setting is wonderful!!  It enhances the picture and you feel like you looking at the people live.However, the sound needs a little help.  I am looking to buy additional speakers.  The sound is good with sports but when watching a regular program the sound tends to be muffled.  Even when I adjust to Clear Voice it isn't crisp.All in All it is a GREAT TV...I'm glad I made the choice to go w/ Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Jiang Zhang
Reviews.Content: Bought it during Thanksgiving sale at $999. It was a great deal. So I feel the TV quality is great.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: A. Lebeck
Reviews.Content: Great TV ~ picture, quality & sound.  Base not as steady as we would like considering TV is 65".  We were not planning to mount it to the wall, but may need to for it to be secure.

Reviews.Title: SIIIIIIIICK TV
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This set is grat but you have to teak the menu for each device to have it look right with no blur but when it is dialed in it is gorgeous

Reviews.Title: Samsung 50-inch led hdtv
Reviews.Author: cheryl
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my daughter, I gave it to her early and she was totally surprised and happy

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: allan hatcher
Reviews.Content: Excellent!! May get one for the bedroom. Highly recommended to be sure.Get one before the price goes sky high.

Reviews.Title: Defective unit
Reviews.Author: TS
Reviews.Content: I first noticed issues with the picture a few weeks after the tv arrived. When I shut the unit down, the screen would go black before completely powering off, but there was a big stretch of space that was lighter than the rest of the screen. I ignored this for a while, largely because the picture looked fine for scenes with a lot of light, colorful images.I then started to notice the lighter space when I watched movies and shows with scenes that featured darker lighting. This space in the center of the screen was much lighter than the rest of the screen, and it became a distraction.I've contacted the seller, and I'm hoping for a replacement. Other than this issue, I'm completely happy with the unit. I will update my review when the seller gets back to me.Update: I contacted the seller with my concerns, and they were not able to help me. I'm going to have to follow up with Samsung. I would NOT recommend buying from this vendor- they do not stand behind their product.

Reviews.Title: nice picture, not enough ports
Reviews.Author: curb your appreciation
Reviews.Content: I knew I was only getting 2 HDMI ports with this one, but it is just not enough. For just a little more I wish I had bought the smart tv, but this is a great basic tv with amazing quality picture.

Reviews.Title: Great Price, Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Brad Hroba
Reviews.Content: This tv i found on sale during thanksgiving time for $1497.99 with FREE shipping. The shipping company took very good care of it, and even installed it on the mount for me with no extra charge.The TV itself has worked flawlessly and its so big, its the first thing that everyone notices when they walk in to my apartment. I have had zero problems with it and will buy an 80" in 5-10 years when this one wears out!

Reviews.Title: no outputs
Reviews.Author: albert
Reviews.Content: The TV has a great picture, the problem I have is there aren't any AV outputs to run it through my stereo, lucky Direct TV has outputs from the box but that doesn't do me any good with my Blu-Ray.

Reviews.Title: Huge Disappointment
Reviews.Author: DR96
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 50" Samsung to replace a 7 or 8 year old 42" Sharp Aquos and according to all reports and reviews I read, Samsung LED's are among the best out there.I bought it on Friday with the hope that i would enjoy the beauty of Augusta National and the Masters in glorious detail on my new, larger, cutting-edge LED TV.How wrong I was!There were three basic screen settings - Dynamic, Standard and Movie. I used Dynamic for everything i watched on my Aquos and started off there just in time for Friday afternoon's coverage on ESPN. However, the colors were so blown out that i just couldn't see any detail. For example one of the players wore a red shirt and it looked almost fluorescent. And then when the ball was rolling over the green there was no definition or detail to the the grass until the camera stilled.Now, I know this is LED and motion blur is part of the package, but I had better results with my old 60hz refresh Aquos. I had anticipated way better performance with 120hz and Samsung's promised 240 clear motion rate. I tried to adjust all the settings, motion blur on/off (On just made the whole screen too dark), auto motion settings did either nothing, or on 'custom' made the image very jerky. For example on a golf swing it looked like you were only seeing every second frame or something - very odd.I found the optimal calibration settings online and they all indicated Movie mode was the way to go, but for me this made the picture look very dull and lacked any 'pop'.By that evening I had become obsessed with this settings conundrum and eventually after many hours settled on a 'Standard' setting with a lot of tweaks which worked fine - not great - just ok. However come Saturday morning and viewing the TV in daylight conditions I needed the dynamic settings back. In standard the colors were very weak and washed out. With the black level increased i got more realistic colors, but the shadows all looked way too dark.Sunday at Augusta was rainy and overcast and I spent most of the afternoon trying to find a combination of settings that didn't blur too much, but still provide decent color reproduction. Unfortunately i couldn't find anything that worked to my satisfaction.On Monday evening i was watching another show and it looked as if it had been filmed in cheap, daytime soap opera mode. Very washed out colors and a lot of motion drag.Having spent way too many hours on this i decided to return the TV and get a Panasonic Viera plasma instead. The difference is staggering. I had the colors set the way i wanted in about 5 minutes, but the difference was all the options looked fine, it was just a case of selecting my favorite combination.The one thing that held me back from Plasma was the glare problem, but i have to say i am getting less of that with the Viera than i had with the Samsung. On balance I would say my old LCD Aquos handled that issue better, but I am so happy with the sharp motion clarity in the plasma that i can take a little bit of reflection.In conclusion, if you are looking for a TV to give you consistent viewing of golf (or any other sports) and don't want to spend half your time trying to find acceptable picture settings DO NOT buy this Samsung. Maybe other more expensive LED's perform better, but after my experiences I don't believe they can touch a decent plasma.

Reviews.Title: Clean unit. I wanted a TV and therefore shied away the smart TV bells and whistles.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Bridges
Reviews.Content: After having purchased this particular model. I think it may be a bit overpriced for the features offered. 2 HDMI? Really? Anyone can put another 2 HDMI plugs to use at some point. I was ignorant for not having seen the potential for more access. I feel certain Smart TV features are the future and my resistance to the technology served me poorly. I gotta admit I was looking forward to plugging my USB stick into the back of the unit and being able to play .avi format movies. This plug, whatever it is will not accept my USB stick. The LED picture itself is superb. Beautiful color and blacks! Even the sound is OK I suppose for those of us non-audiophile types. Overall I wish I had opted for the $200 spend to get Smart TV and more HDMI utility. But what is there is of the highest quality.

Reviews.Title: ****SAMSUNG MAKES DEFECTIVE TELEVISIONS WITH COSTLY SERVICE****
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  Maybe $2,500.00 - $3,000.00 is not a lot of money for some folks to spend on a television, but it is to me.  This is money I'll never get back, nor derive true enjoyment, nor value from due to the DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG product that I purchased.  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems as in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as the same DEFECT in many other DEFECTIVE SAMUNG models.  This defect occurs upon start-up, and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture gets progressively worse over time and continuously declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00!Furthermore, I was informed that the repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel" that costs $1,300.00 for the part plus $279.00 to install, plus taxes......all told, another $1,719.16....at which point the technician basically stated, "just buy another TV."SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at a rate of 20% per year, and that they do not repair any of their products after 4 years!  Their own repair people told me to just buy a new set!!!If I save one family the heartache of losing they're hard-earned money on SYSTEMICALLY DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS, and a company that offers zero customer service....I'll be happy!  God bless....SAMSUNG CONS:No Customer SupportSystemic Panel DefectGhosting of imagesBurn-in on screenDistorted pictureVery expensive to repair

Reviews.Title: Samsung Isn't Fibbing
Reviews.Author: SPARKER
Reviews.Content: I have 6 large screen flat panel TVs at 3 different hovels: I Sony Bravia and 5 Samsungs in this model line. The Sony panel is center lit, which is supposed to be superior to the edge lit Samsungs. Samsung claims they achieve center lit quality through edge lighting coupled with some mystery algorithm. They do. The picture on the Samsung screens, in this series, and whether 60, 55,50, 48, or 42 inches is every bit as good--and marginally better in the 60. Seems Samsung isn't fibbing. And they cost a bit less.

Reviews.Title: Samsung is always a safe bet
Reviews.Author: bjtaylor
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Samsung although fairly more expensive than competitive products.  Not disappointed.  Solid product, excellent picture and of course perfect out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Enjoy
Reviews.Author: Jackie Winns
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my television . The picture quality is excellent, and it fits very nicely in my family room.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: GY
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, we are very happy with the choice. We wanted LED TV, looked for different options on the market and really enjoyed our choice. It's our first Samsung purchase, nice choice so far!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sherri
Reviews.Content: I love my new TV. The only reason it did not get 5 stars is because the screen has a glare from my windows that my older Samsung TV did not have. In the evening, the picture is wonderful. I will be investing in some curtains so the screen will be better during the daylight hours.

Reviews.Title: Snail Shipping, Great TV
Reviews.Author: John Curtis "jgcurtis"
Reviews.Content: I expect TV will be just what I want. However my previous Samsung HL-T5087S developed acne after five years of otherwise good service. By acne I mean white spots on screen caused by metal fatigue mirror failures in the Digital Light Processor (DLP). Takes 3 to 5 years to start, then blooms. This is well known now and the DLPs are no longer in use in consumer TVs I believe. Repair is estimated at 400 dollars and up. Part is like $165. Replacement and realignment is said to be critical and not easy for DIY.Well, I haven't received this new one yet. It was ordered 8 days ago. I found the shipment sitting locally waiting for delivery instructions. They want to be sure you are home. Shipper said they had either called or emailed me to contact them. I received no email as I was watching carefully in-box and spam-box. Finally I phoned them using number I found on Amazon site. Now it is scheduled for tomorrow. Original ETA was yesterday. Shipper is CEVA. Not much I can do about it, there is no place to post feedback on the shipper. Old TV was dismantled and removed two days ago. Watching Olympics on postage stamp screen.,Finally, their tracking information is totally useless as no locations are provided after the first. All you can see is that it is moving from somewhere to somewhere. And their ETA turned out wrong although TV had arrived was held locally from that date.I've been spoiled by Amazon. But the shipping charge was FREE so how can I complain?UPDATE:TV arrived three days late. Lucky I called CEVA morning of third day. They said they had emailed request to arrange delivery time but I never saw it, and I was watching for it.Two men delivered TV, unpacked, plugged in, lifted into my enclosure and helped a bit with my connection. HDMI's are at a bad angle/location and I couldn't line up for insertion.All they really want to see is if picture is there and get signature for receipt.I went through all the menus on the set. They are pretty well arranged and easy to adjust. There are many, many picture and sound choices but I eventually got it suitable for a start. Picture is gorgeous. Sound is clear. Thin bezel saves lots of space. It has a small hidden joy stick under the bottom bezel. I wonder how may people never notice and hence never use it.Manual is horrible. Samsung should be ashamed. Very small dense type, double sided small pages and folded like a road map, three of them! Very exasperating for me to read and navigate. I had downloaded one manual and studied before it came so I was partly prepared. Tried to print larger with no size improvement but at least I printed and stapled into proper book form.All in all, well suited to my needs. I use two HdMI and one composite video from security camera. Ability to update firmware from thumb drive is handy.

Reviews.Title: Big screen, beautiful picture, not-so-great UI controls
Reviews.Author: Inconclusive Panda
Reviews.Content: I was contemplating getting the 55", but I'm glad I went with the 50".  This thing is huge.  I love that you can control the brightness on the TV, and that it can automatically set the brightness based on the ambient light.  The base is pretty ugly, and I've seen more beautiful edges on other TVs.  The remote is quite ugly, and the backlighting on it is weak.  The user interface on the TV could use a lot of improvement.  Also, the position of the HDMI inputs is awkward on the side.  If you're mounting the TV, you will be able to see those cords pretty clearly.  Other than that, I have no complaints with the picture - everything that's 1080 is quite crisp.  If you don't have a receiver, the built-in audio is decent.Completely unrelated, and sadly prompted by a recent home break-in: always record the serial number of your TV and keep the box and manual.  It will help with warranty claims, theft, etc.

Reviews.Title: terrible picture quality
Reviews.Author: J. Bird
Reviews.Content: shocked that it gets such great reviews.  It seems to be "made for the outlet" its a cheaply constructed TV which basically keeps passing muster because its 65"We returned it and re-hung our 5 year old 47" philips flat screen and feel ashamed that we ever needed more.  If you are going to spend $1,000 on this; please heed my advice and spend a little more on something higher quality; and buy it at Sams club to save the hassle of large-item returns through the mail.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste money
Reviews.Author: suhong zhang
Reviews.Content: Bought size 65 but the picture qality is poor. Don't waste your money and buy something else. I wish I could have done more research.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Valerie Benson
Reviews.Content: I bought this set at Best Buy; should have bought it from Amazon for $200 less; actually, shouldn't have bought it at all. Nothing but problems and very bad customer service. I thought I was pretty safe buying a name brand with lots of positive reviews. Then I talked to a friend that had terrible experience with a couple of Samsungs. He told me to google Samsung capacitor which I did and I found what has to be thousands of complaints about Samsung TVs being defective.I strongly recommend that you do a lot of research before spending your money on a Samsung. The price vs features is great, but they are not reliable.

Reviews.Title: WHAT A FRUSTRATING PURCHASE!!!
Reviews.Author: Woody
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tv, after much searching and comparing.....but, after only 4 DAYS, the tv did not have a picture!!  We now  sit here without our 65" tv that we were so excited about.  Samsung sent a repairman out and he determined that it needed a new panel that has to be ordered; after talking with Samsung and getting transferred to different departments, I was told that they will not any type of 'compensation' for the inconvenience, except the repair service that came out.I DO NOT HAVE A GOOD FEELING ABOUT SAMSUNG AND THE CUSTOMER SERVICE - VERY DISAPPOINTING!

Reviews.Title: It is just OK for the amount of money we paid
Reviews.Author: Yongqiang Feng
Reviews.Content: Picture, sound quality and convenience of use is just average, considering the item is slightly overpriced, because of it is "Samsung"?1) It will be better if it can provide more HDMI ports.2) Stand is not well designed. The screen vibrated significantly when I stepped on my wooden floor around it. I kind of worry if it will fell down.3) It is heavy, though it was said "slim".

Reviews.Title: Samsung 50"
Reviews.Author: Evelyn Vazquez
Reviews.Content: Love it, easy to assemble.  Great picture quality.  Anymore can just adjust it.  The price was great.  I love Samsung

Reviews.Title: 50 inch Samsung
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: Really like this TV as I got a wonderful price. It doesn't have the smart technology, but I didn't want that. I think my 40 inch LCD had a slightly better picture. I am happy with my buy.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: somrtoy
Reviews.Content: was told by the person I order it from amazon that he would send me a gift of 155.00 after I purchased the tv..... I was absolutely shocked( in a good way) then was told later it wasn't sooooooo..... REAL ISSUE WITH THIS LIE!!!!!!!! other than that the tv is great

Reviews.Title: bad picture uniformity updated: fixed
Reviews.Author: The Mouse Jockey
Reviews.Content: Updated:  Changed from 1 to 4 stars.  Thanks to a customer comment and MUCH to my suprise, I rubbed the screen with a soft flanel and felt the screen reseat into the frame.  There must have been a slight air gap between assembly layers from shipping or setup that was causing the light bean shape in dark sceens.  The problem has been fixed and hopefully fixes it for good. I'll update the customer photos soon.Last spring I purchased the 40" Samsung 40ES6500 smart TV and love the picture but don't use the smart TV features.  When I saw the 65EH6000 model for about $1,000 cheaper than the equivalent sized 65es6500 model, I was hoping for the same quality picture minus the smart TV and extra inputs I do not need.  Unfortunately what I got was a splotchy reflecting pond of non-uniformity in dark scenes.  This is seriously distracting and a show stopper.  I'll be returning the TV this week.  If the replacement is better I'll update this review.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed !!!
Reviews.Author: Music Man
Reviews.Content: This TV was replacing our old Toshiba , and it is very disappointing ! Samsung TVs get great reviews on Amazon which factored my decision on purchasing this one.  Even after calibrating, the picture is really bad. HD doesn't look HD at all and yes we have an HDMI very good cable. I have since read that Toshibas use lower quality panels. My version is a C and that might be the picture problem. We have a picture window and this Samsung TV reflects the window in the day even with blinds closed and at night I can plainly see my lamp in the TV. We didn't have that problem with our Toshiba. Does anyone have recommendations for Tv's that do not reflect windows etc?? What Tv has the sharpest HD picture?This TV is going back to Walmart asap !  I would not recommend buying this TV !

Reviews.Title: BEWARE SAMSUNG
Reviews.Author: Jon Camrud
Reviews.Content: Samsung has the absolute worst customer service and phone support. They run you through question after question and try to solve issues by the book instead of listening to your problem and knowing a solution -- they just run through a huge checklist instead of jumping ahead to the problem.They use every tactic in the book to stop you from getting a supervisor, including fake disconnects, putting you on hold for extended periods and telling you a supervisor will call you back. Don't fall for this. Just don't buy their products.They refuse to honor warranties, from what I can tell.The problem? My remote control power button stopped working. Second TV remote in a row that has done this with a Samsung TV. They just aren't built well. In both cases it was right around one year. If you do buy a Samsung TV, just before your warranty expires, request that they replace your remote... you can at least get another year out of it before paying for repairs.If you are not a technical person, don't buy this TV. The setup is not intuitive and is a real hassle. When I called to get some basic info I had the same phone support problems as noted above. Total feature bloat on these TVs.I'll never buy another Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Not a good experience
Reviews.Author: Ram  Manivasagam
Reviews.Content: This is my first time for me buying a big item like this from Amazon. After a long thought process decided to buy it from Amazon though the same offer was available from other local companies. First, the product got delayed - Thanks-giving order reached us only this week. Second the delivery truck which brought the TV had just the driver. I have ended up in helping him to move the TV from outside to all the way to room. I was planning to leave my old in-laws at home for delivery but at last minute I changed and now I think that it is a great idea. Otherwise my in laws would have ended in lifting the TV. I could not imagine how difficult it would be when it is quite difficult for me to lift it. Third - I was fully charged that i got this new piece. The person accompanied said that he will show the TV for checking and asked me to show the power plug. We both lifted the TV and he connected it to the plug and asked me to check it - We need to first rest the TV somewhere safe, so that we can check it properly. He rested it against the wall and asked me to check it- looks like he was in a hurry. I thought the customer service was the best piece in Amazon but did not feel that way when i bought this item.  I would have expected to delivery  person to put the TV on some on the stand so that we can properly check everything.There is quick fix stand with the TV and it would have taken only 5 minutes to fix it.Overall the delivery experience is very bad for me this time. Yet to see the picture quality

Reviews.Title: I feel cheated.
Reviews.Author: SeaSoak
Reviews.Content: I feel cheated. The TV did not work because it was shipped already broken. I believe I asked for proof of the test the tech did on this TV when I didn't accept delivery the first time. I have not received any more information. All I want is a refund.
